The Collection of Address related data points that are used in many contexts.The Collection of Address related data points that are used in many contexts.
The primary use case for this container is to support mailling material to the address.
V2 ADDRESS container was implicitly a mailing container, V3 will be explicitly for mail.
With in this use case there are sub cases.
1. Transfer of information so that the recipient may mail to a personal address as a single piece of mail
2. Transfer of information so that the recipient may send a package by mean including, but not restricted to the USPS
3. Transfer of information so that the recipient may include the address in a bulk mailing to a personal address
4. Transfer of information so that the recipient may mail a single piece of may to a business

Address is based upon USPS publication 28.
Pub-28 has two sections, format of an address on a piece of mail and data points that MAY compose an address.
The data point noun children of ADDRESS are the union components of an address on a piece of mail or a package.  The reciever of an address that uses it to format a mail label would need to appliy the formating requirements of pub-28.

For example: Pub 28 refers to the address "last line" as being composed of the City &lt;&lt;single space&gt;&gt;State&lt;&lt;single space&gt;&gt;ZIP. Insertion of the space seperators would be the responsibility of the mail sender system. The ADDRESS container holds the City, State and Postal code values.

Postal Code vs ZIP CODE
MISMO V2 used Postal Code, to to represent the possibility of the mail recipient being at an address outside the US. We will continue that distinction.

Pub-28 defines a mail format that is complient with the international mailing standard defined by the UPU.  Pub-28 points out that for mail that crosses internationl borders the format of the sending country should be used. The USPS international format is to have COUNTRY as the last line of the address on the piece of mail.  The ADDRESS container has a noun child data point for Country. It is the responiblity of the user of the data to plac to correct values on the piece of mail correctly.

NEED TO IDENTIFY THE NAME OF THE FIELDS IN THE PUB 28 WHEN MISMO CHOOSES TO DIVERT

Include information regarding if...then on using unparsed vs. parsed information

On the front of a piece of mail the USPS recommends all captial letters. The noun data point children od the ADDRESS element may be used in contexts other than the labels of Mail.  Therefore it is permisable for the content of the non data point children of ADDRESS to be mixed case.

ADDRESS has an extension point. Trading partners that agree to use anther address standard may use this extention point.  For example an international organization that adheres to the OASIS XAL standard internally MAY use the extention point to provide data in the format of that namespace.  The XAL standard is built to support 
- Addresses of 241+ Countries 
- Represented in 5,000+ languages/dialects  
- With 130+ Address Formats, and  
- With 36+ Personal Name formats 

A piece of mail that originates in a particular coutry must meet the requirements of the postal sysme of the originating company.  XAL can hold the data required by the union of requirements in 241+ countries. To assists users of the ADDRESS content meet domestic USPS standards it is strongly recommended that trading partner that select to include XAL extension also populate the noun children elements of ADDRESS.  It would be a kindness to the consumers of the data if the producer also managaged the XAL to USPS mapping by populating it.

USPS PUB 28 assembles City State ZIP into "Last Line".  This is a misnomer beacues it is not always the last line. V2 had attributes of ADDRESS  for City, State, PostalCode.  We will have the same data as noun data point children of ADDRESS

A postal carrier route code is a part of the complete carrier route. The carrier route code is 4 characters consisting of 1 letter for the type of carrier route  and 3 digits for the carrier route. The complete carrier route identifies a group of addresses to which the USPS assigns the same code to aid in mail delivery.  The complete Carrier Route consists of 9 digits – 5 numbers for the ZIP Code and the 4 characters fo the carrier route code.
The name of the city.

xsd:documentation.$t: A check digit calculated using the MOD 10 method on the total of all 10 digits that make up the bar code for use in the Delivery Point Bar Code &&#35;40;DPBC&&#35;41;. The DPBC is an 11 digit &&#35;40;plus check digit&&#35;41; barcode, containing the ZIP Code, ZIP+4 Code, and the delivery point code. This is the predominant barcode in use currently &&#35;40;as of 2008&&#35;41;, and it enables the Postal Service to sort mail into delivery point &&#35;40;address&&#35;41; sequence.

A code maintained by the USPS representing a delivery point &&#35;40;DP&&#35;41; which is a single mailbox or other place at which mail is delivered. This may be appended to the combination of zip code and zip+4 code for the purposes of creating a barcode.
Uniquely identifies an individual or office within a private company for the purposes of internal mail distribution. USPS calls this a MailStop Code &&#35;40;MSC&&#35;41;.
This is the additional four digits in the code
The postal code &&#35;40;ZIP Code in the US&&#35;41; for the address. ZIP Code may be either 5 or 9 digits.
The identifier of the locked box located in the post office lobby or other authorized place that customers may rent for delivery of mail.
An address for mail that is to be delivered to a rural postal delivery route including both the rural route identifier and the box identifier.
The two-character representation of the US state, US Territory, Canadian Province, Military APO FPO, or Territory.
The name of the US state, US Territory, Canadian Province, Military APO FPO, or Territory.

xsd:documentation.$t: The AUDIT_TRAIL_ENTRY element describes an action performed on the document that affects its state. Each entry should have a corresponding set of DOCUMENT/ SYSTEM_SIGNATURES to create a tamper-evident seal over the audit entry as well as the affected portions of the document.

The AUDIT_TRAIL_ENTRY element describes an action performed on the document that affects its state. Each entry should have a corresponding set of DOCUMENT/ SYSTEM_SIGNATURES to create a tamper-evident seal over the audit entry as well as the affected portions of the document.

Used to hold content that is not part of the namespace or version of the MISMO V3 model  It is either contained directly &&#35;40;via EmbeddedContentXML&&#35;41; or indirectly &&#35;40;via LocationURI&&#35;41;. A FOREIGN_OBJECT can be Encoded in a variety of manners without changing its underlying meaning. However, the Encoding of EmbeddedContentXML MUST result in a schema-valid representation. The representation and Encoding are the only transformations supported by the model.

A single digit number which is the first digit of all the blocks which comprise the block group. A statistical subdivision of a census tract, a block group is the smallest geographic unit for which the Census Bureau tabulates sample data. Example: block group 3 consists of all blocks within a 2000 census tract numbering from 3000 to 3999. In 1990, block group 3 consisted of all blocks numbered from 301 to 399Z

A four-digit number to identify a census block. A subdivision of a census tract, a block is the smallest geographic unit for which the Census Bureau tabulates 100-percent data. Many blocks correspond to individual city blocks bounded by streets, but blocks -- especially in rural areas -- may include many square miles and may have some boundaries that are not streets.

A four-digit number used to identify a census tract. A census tract is a small, relatively permanent statistical subdivision of a county delineated by a local committee of census data users for the purpose of presenting data.Census tract numbers are always unique within a county and usually unique within an MA. Almost all census tract numbers range from 0001 to 9499. Leading zeros are not shown on the Census Bureau’s maps or in its printed reports.
Identifies census tract as defined by the U.S. Census Bureau where subject property is located.

Census tract suffixes may range from 01 to 98. Many census tracts do not have a suffix; in such cases, the suffix field is either left blank or is zero-filled. The decimal point separating the four-digit basic tract number from the two-digit suffix is shown in printed reports, in microfiche, and on census maps; in machine-readable files, the decimal point is implied.

The Collection of Address related data points that are used in many contexts.The Collection of Address related data points that are used in many contexts.
The primary use case for this container is to support mailling material to the address.
V2 ADDRESS container was implicitly a mailing container, V3 will be explicitly for mail.
With in this use case there are sub cases.
1. Transfer of information so that the recipient may mail to a personal address as a single piece of mail
2. Transfer of information so that the recipient may send a package by mean including, but not restricted to the USPS
3. Transfer of information so that the recipient may include the address in a bulk mailing to a personal address
4. Transfer of information so that the recipient may mail a single piece of may to a business

Address is based upon USPS publication 28.
Pub-28 has two sections, format of an address on a piece of mail and data points that MAY compose an address.
The data point noun children of ADDRESS are the union components of an address on a piece of mail or a package.  The reciever of an address that uses it to format a mail label would need to appliy the formating requirements of pub-28.

For example: Pub 28 refers to the address "last line" as being composed of the City &lt;&lt;single space&gt;&gt;State&lt;&lt;single space&gt;&gt;ZIP. Insertion of the space seperators would be the responsibility of the mail sender system. The ADDRESS container holds the City, State and Postal code values.

Postal Code vs ZIP CODE
MISMO V2 used Postal Code, to to represent the possibility of the mail recipient being at an address outside the US. We will continue that distinction.

Pub-28 defines a mail format that is complient with the international mailing standard defined by the UPU.  Pub-28 points out that for mail that crosses internationl borders the format of the sending country should be used. The USPS international format is to have COUNTRY as the last line of the address on the piece of mail.  The ADDRESS container has a noun child data point for Country. It is the responiblity of the user of the data to plac to correct values on the piece of mail correctly.

Information needed to represent a single complex electronic document. It allows transport of any version 3.x DOCUMENT.  Its children allow unified delivery of the document rendered in a particular viewing technology such as HTML or PDF. Used to identify the alternate location of content. Used to reduce the redundancy of a message by placing common content in a alternative location and replacing it with the REFERENCE element that points to that location. A message recipient MAY replace the content of the referenced location for the REFERENCE element before processing or may process the information from that location. Processing XML encryption or XML signature will ALWAYS require replacement of the REFERENCE element with the content or the referenced location. The referenced location MAY be internal to the current XML document or it MAY be external. When internal there WILL NOT be a LocationURI child element. The referenced content MAY or MAY NOT be located at a place other than the root element of the external location.  If it is NOT the root element the LocationXPath child element identifies the location within the located XML document. For an external reference the LocationXPath is ALWAYS and absolute path from the document root. For and internal reference the LocationXPath child element value MAY absolute of relative.
Used as a place to carry any V3.x DOCUMENT that is of a differnent MISMO Version than that of the MESSAGE

The Map Element contains or points to stylesheets for generating or populating document views based on the contents of the DATA and/or SIGNATORY elements. The Collection of Address related data points that are used in many contexts.The Collection of Address related data points that are used in many contexts.
The primary use case for this container is to support mailling material to the address.
V2 ADDRESS container was implicitly a mailing container, V3 will be explicitly for mail.
With in this use case there are sub cases.
1. Transfer of information so that the recipient may mail to a personal address as a single piece of mail
2. Transfer of information so that the recipient may send a package by mean including, but not restricted to the USPS
3. Transfer of information so that the recipient may include the address in a bulk mailing to a personal address
4. Transfer of information so that the recipient may mail a single piece of may to a business

Address is based upon USPS publication 28.
Pub-28 has two sections, format of an address on a piece of mail and data points that MAY compose an address.
The data point noun children of ADDRESS are the union components of an address on a piece of mail or a package.  The reciever of an address that uses it to format a mail label would need to appliy the formating requirements of pub-28.

For example: Pub 28 refers to the address "last line" as being composed of the City &lt;&lt;single space&gt;&gt;State&lt;&lt;single space&gt;&gt;ZIP. Insertion of the space seperators would be the responsibility of the mail sender system. The ADDRESS container holds the City, State and Postal code values.

Postal Code vs ZIP CODE
MISMO V2 used Postal Code, to to represent the possibility of the mail recipient being at an address outside the US. We will continue that distinction.

Pub-28 defines a mail format that is complient with the international mailing standard defined by the UPU.  Pub-28 points out that for mail that crosses internationl borders the format of the sending country should be used. The USPS international format is to have COUNTRY as the last line of the address on the piece of mail.  The ADDRESS container has a noun child data point for Country. It is the responiblity of the user of the data to plac to correct values on the piece of mail correctly.

The Collection of Address related data points that are used in many contexts.The Collection of Address related data points that are used in many contexts.
The primary use case for this container is to support mailling material to the address.
V2 ADDRESS container was implicitly a mailing container, V3 will be explicitly for mail.
With in this use case there are sub cases.
1. Transfer of information so that the recipient may mail to a personal address as a single piece of mail
2. Transfer of information so that the recipient may send a package by mean including, but not restricted to the USPS
3. Transfer of information so that the recipient may include the address in a bulk mailing to a personal address
4. Transfer of information so that the recipient may mail a single piece of may to a business

Address is based upon USPS publication 28.
Pub-28 has two sections, format of an address on a piece of mail and data points that MAY compose an address.
The data point noun children of ADDRESS are the union components of an address on a piece of mail or a package.  The reciever of an address that uses it to format a mail label would need to appliy the formating requirements of pub-28.

For example: Pub 28 refers to the address "last line" as being composed of the City &lt;&lt;single space&gt;&gt;State&lt;&lt;single space&gt;&gt;ZIP. Insertion of the space seperators would be the responsibility of the mail sender system. The ADDRESS container holds the City, State and Postal code values.

Postal Code vs ZIP CODE
MISMO V2 used Postal Code, to to represent the possibility of the mail recipient being at an address outside the US. We will continue that distinction.

Pub-28 defines a mail format that is complient with the international mailing standard defined by the UPU.  Pub-28 points out that for mail that crosses internationl borders the format of the sending country should be used. The USPS international format is to have COUNTRY as the last line of the address on the piece of mail.  The ADDRESS container has a noun child data point for Country. It is the responiblity of the user of the data to plac to correct values on the piece of mail correctly.

NEED TO IDENTIFY THE NAME OF THE FIELDS IN THE PUB 28 WHEN MISMO CHOOSES TO DIVERT

Include information regarding if...then on using unparsed vs. parsed information

The FIELD_REFERENCE type is a group of XML fields used for indentifying the area of the view described by a VIEW_FIELD element. The preferred method is to use the FieldPlaceHolderIdentifier. When that is not supported by the view format, then the field is identified by its XY coordinates using the other elements in this XML type.
The height of the view field area, in measurement units.

The identifier of the object in the view that represents the view field area. The identification method is dependent upon the view file format. For example, in an XHTML view, this is the id of the span or div tag that constitutes the view field. In a PDF view, this is the PDF field name.
The width of the view field area, in measurement units.
The type of measurement unit used to express the top offset, the left offset, the width and the height of the view field area. Available options are: Inches, Centimeters, Points and Pixels.
The distance, in measurement units, from the left edge of the page to the left edge of the view field area.
The distance, in measurement units, from the top edge of the page to the top edge of the view field area.
The page number of the page that contains this field reference.

These Country codes are part of the Federal Information Processing Standards &&#35;40;FIPS&&#35;41;, an official coding system developed by the National Institute of Standards and Technology &&#35;40;NIST, formerly the National Bureau of Standards&&#35;41;, U.S. Department of Commerce, and maintained by the U.S. Geological Survey &&#35;40;USGS&&#35;41;

xsd:documentation.$t:
The Federal Information Processing Standards &&#35;40;FIPS&&#35;41; County Subdivision Code identifies all county subdivisions in the 50 states, District of Columbia and Puerto Rico. 
The Minor Civil Division &&#35;40;MCD&&#35;41; and Census County Division &&#35;40;CCD&&#35;41; are geocodes that are part of the FIPS 55 system, developed by the National Institute of Standards and Technology &&#35;40;NIST&&#35;41; and now maintained by the U.S. Geological Survey. The FIPS 55 system identifies named entities with a unique five-digit numeric locality code. The FIPS 55 locality codes identify governmentally functioning MCDs within a numeric range from 00001 to 89999. The codes in this range also represent incorporated places, Census Designated Places &&#35;40;CDP&&#35;41;, and Alaska Native and American Indian areas, together with other entities not included in the tabulations of the decennial census, such as named localities, military installations, and National Parks. All these entity names are combined and listed in a single alphabetic sequence. The FIPS code range, 90000 to 98999, is reserved for CCDs and nonfunctioning MCDs where they cover whole States, whole counties, or their statistically equivalent entities.
The formal name or description for a county subdivision that is referenced by the FIPS County Subdivision Code. For example,  Jones Township.

A legal or statistical division of a county recognized as part of the Federal Information Processing Standards &&#35;40;FIPS&&#35;41; 55 system. The two major types of county subdivisions are census county divisions and minor civil divisions. This information is used by the US Census Bureau.

A five-digit numeric code assigned by the  National Institute of Standards and Technology &&#35;40;NIST&&#35;41;, and maintained by the U.S. Geological Survey &&#35;40;USGS&&#35;41;, to identify populated places, primary county divisions, and other locational entities within a State. The NIST assigns the codes based on the alphabetic sequence of the entity names; it documents the codes in FIPS PUB 55. This information is used by the US Census Bureau.

The formal name of a statistical entity as defined by the by the  National Institute of Standards and Technology &&#35;40;NIST&&#35;41;, and maintained by the U.S. Geological Survey &&#35;40;USGS&&#35;41;, that is referenced by the FIPS Place Code.  Place includes Census Bureau designated places, consolidated cities, and incorporated places. This is also represented by the 5-digit FIPS Place Code. This information is used by the US Census Bureau.

A unique two letter alpha code to identify each State and State equivalent entity.  These State codes are part of the Federal Information Processing Standards &&#35;40;FIPS&&#35;41;, an official coding system developed by the National Institute of Standards and Technology &&#35;40;NIST, formerly the National Bureau of Standards&&#35;41;, U.S. Department of Commerce, and maintained by the U.S. Geological Survey &&#35;40;USGS&&#35;41;. The FIPS state alpha code for each U.S. states and the District of Columbia is identical to the postal abbreviations by the United States Postal Service. Since September 3, 1987, the same has been true of the alpha code for each of the outlying areas, with the exception of U.S. Minor Outlying Islands &&#35;40;UM&&#35;41; as the USPS routes mail for these islands indirectly.

xsd:appinfo.$t: Renamed. Used to be State FIPS Alpha Code.

Used to hold content that is not part of the namespace or version of the MISMO V3 model  It is either contained directly &&#35;40;via EmbeddedContentXML&&#35;41; or indirectly &&#35;40;via LocationURI&&#35;41;. A FOREIGN_OBJECT can be Encoded in a variety of manners without changing its underlying meaning. However, the Encoding of EmbeddedContentXML MUST result in a schema-valid representation. The representation and Encoding are the only transformations supported by the model.
The external URI from which the object content can be retrieved.

The XML compatible byte stream in the encoding of the EncodingType that when decoded is a resource of the MediaType using characters from the CharacterEncodingSetType. If a binary EncodingType is not used &&#35;40;e.g. "None" or "EscapedXML"&&#35;41; then the CharacterEncodingSetType must be the same as that used for the XML instance document.
Specifies the character encoding set used by the resource content.
A free-form text field used to capture the resource Character Encoding Set type if Other is selected for CharacterEncodingSetType.

Indicates the Multipurpose Internet Mail Extensions type of the data in the resource. A registered list of these types is available at http://www.iana.org/assignments/media-types/ AND http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc2045.  In addition, there is a defined syntax for custom MIME types that should be followed when the type is not registered with IANA.

Gives the location of a place on Earth  north or south of the equator. Lines of Latitude are the horizontal lines shown running east-to-west on maps &&#35;40;particularly so in the Mercator projection&&#35;41;. Technically, latitude is an angular measurement in degrees ranging from 0 degrees at the equator &&#35;40;low latitude&&#35;41; to 90 degree at the poles &&#35;40;90 degree N or +90 degree for the North Pole and 90 degree S or −90 degree for the South Pole&&#35;41;.
MAL: 10/12 - May be replaced by OpenGeoSpacial.org GPS standard

The geographic coordinate most commonly used in cartography and global navigation for east-west measurement. It is the angular distance measured east or west and usually expressed in degrees &&#35;40;or hours&&#35;41;, minutes, and seconds, from the prime meridian, defined to be at the Royal Observatory, Greenwich, in England, to the meridian passing through another position on the earth's surface.
MAL: 10/12 - May be replaced by OpenGeoSpacial.org GPS standard

The Collection of Address related data points that are used in many contexts.The Collection of Address related data points that are used in many contexts.
The primary use case for this container is to support mailling material to the address.
V2 ADDRESS container was implicitly a mailing container, V3 will be explicitly for mail.
With in this use case there are sub cases.
1. Transfer of information so that the recipient may mail to a personal address as a single piece of mail
2. Transfer of information so that the recipient may send a package by mean including, but not restricted to the USPS
3. Transfer of information so that the recipient may include the address in a bulk mailing to a personal address
4. Transfer of information so that the recipient may mail a single piece of may to a business

Address is based upon USPS publication 28.
Pub-28 has two sections, format of an address on a piece of mail and data points that MAY compose an address.
The data point noun children of ADDRESS are the union components of an address on a piece of mail or a package.  The reciever of an address that uses it to format a mail label would need to appliy the formating requirements of pub-28.

For example: Pub 28 refers to the address "last line" as being composed of the City &lt;&lt;single space&gt;&gt;State&lt;&lt;single space&gt;&gt;ZIP. Insertion of the space seperators would be the responsibility of the mail sender system. The ADDRESS container holds the City, State and Postal code values.

Postal Code vs ZIP CODE
MISMO V2 used Postal Code, to to represent the possibility of the mail recipient being at an address outside the US. We will continue that distinction.

Pub-28 defines a mail format that is complient with the international mailing standard defined by the UPU.  Pub-28 points out that for mail that crosses internationl borders the format of the sending country should be used. The USPS international format is to have COUNTRY as the last line of the address on the piece of mail.  The ADDRESS container has a noun child data point for Country. It is the responiblity of the user of the data to plac to correct values on the piece of mail correctly.

NEED TO IDENTIFY THE NAME OF THE FIELDS IN THE PUB 28 WHEN MISMO CHOOSES TO DIVERT

Include information regarding if...then on using unparsed vs. parsed information

The INTERACTIVE_FIELD element points to and describes an area of the view to be filled out with formatted textual data by an end user, usually a signer of the document and usually at signing time.

Contains the identifier of the object in the view that contains the field presentation. In an XHTML view, this is the id attribute of the span or div tag that constitutes the field. In a PDF view, this is the PDF field name

The FIELD_REFERENCE type is a group of XML fields used for indentifying the area of the view described by a VIEW_FIELD element. The preferred method is to use the FieldPlaceHolderIdentifier. When that is not supported by the view format, then the field is identified by its XY coordinates using the other elements in this XML type.

Specifies the name of the mutually exclusive group this interactive field belongs to. A mutually exclusive field group is the set of fields that share the same value for this element. At any given time, only one of the fields in the group can be checked. This feature is used to define interactive fields that are used to express a choice of the signer with regards to specific provisions offered in the document. For example, one could create a field group to allow the signer to select the type of insurance coverage desired; there is one field associated with each coverage option, by clicking on one of the fields, the signer is declaring his/her option for the associate coverage option.
The dollar amount of interest accrued on the loan between the last paid installment date and the date reported.
The amount of interest accrued but not yet paid for Daily Simple Interest loans. This interest is considered overdue interest and is paid first when a payment is applied.

The amount of interest due with the first payment in addition to the regular payment as a result of the loan funding on a date other than one month prior to the due date &&#35;40;if interest is paid in arrears&&#35;41;. This amount will be zero if odd interest was paid at closing.

xsd:documentation.$t: The maximum number of percentage points by which the interest rate can decrease from the Periodic Base Rate until the next base rate selection date.

xsd:appinfo.$t: Renamed.  Used to be "Periodic Maximum Decrease Rate".

xsd:documentation.$t: The maximum number of percentage points by which the interest rate can increase from the Periodic Base Rate until the next base rate selection date.

xsd:appinfo.$t: Renamed.  Used to be "Periodic Maximum Increase Rate".

xsd:documentation.$t: The date on which a new base rate is to be determined for future periodic interest rate calculations.
The number of payments between interest rate changes for which the periodic cap is in effect. At the end of the period a new base rate is established.
An integer value used to provide an order to multi-instance sibling elements.
Data that describes the rules that govern one or more interest rate adjustments.
Specifies whether the occurrence of the adjustment is the first change or a subsequent change.

xsd:appinfo.$t: Originally First Adjustment Rule Indicator; changed to enumeration in Version 3

xsd:documentation.$t: A description of any interest rate calculation period that ignores per change, periodic or lifetime interest rate limits.

The number of payment periods between interest rate change dates that notices are generated, if notices are not sent to the mortgagor for every change. If a loans interest rate changes every month but notices are only mailed once a year, 12 will be entered in this field.
The number of payments between rate changes.
The number of payments from the interest rate change payment due date to the date of the first interest rate to be used if the rate averaging is applicable.
The stated maximum, expressed as a percent, to which the interest rate can increase to in this adjustment period.

xsd:appinfo.$t: Should be used in lieu of Rate Adjustment First Change Cap Rate.

xsd:documentation.$t: The percentage by which the new index is multiplied to arrive at a new interest rate. Most commonly used for Fannie Mae STABLE ARM products.

xsd:appinfo.$t: Renamed.  Used to be "Per Change Percent of Index Factor Rate".

xsd:documentation.$t: The stated minimum, expressed as a percent, to which the interest rate can decrease to in this adjustment period.

xsd:appinfo.$t: Should be used in lieu of Rate Adjustment First Change Floor Rate

xsd:documentation.$t: Describes when the rate is rounded relative to checking other rules.
The maximum number of percentage points by which the rate can decrease from the previous interest rate.

xsd:appinfo.$t: Should be used in lieu of Rate Adjustment First Rate Floor Percent

xsd:documentation.$t: The maximum number of percentage points by which the rate can increase from the previous interest rate.

xsd:appinfo.$t: Should be used in lieu of Rate Adjustment Initial Cap Percent

Indicates how interest rate changes are to be calculated.

The date when the Interest Rate Per Change Adjustment Rule first becomes applicable. The Interest Rate Per Change Adjustment Rule remains in effect unless another Interest Rate Per Change Adjustment Rule with a later date is present on the loan.
The period of time, expressed in months, that the Interest Rate Per Change Adjustment Rule is in effect.
The number of months between rate adjustments, if the interest rate on the subject loan can change.
The number of payments for which the Interest Rate Per Change Adjustment Rule is applicable.

The total number of days for which interim or prepaid interest is to be paid.

The Collection of Address related data points that are used in many contexts.The Collection of Address related data points that are used in many contexts.
The primary use case for this container is to support mailling material to the address.
V2 ADDRESS container was implicitly a mailing container, V3 will be explicitly for mail.
With in this use case there are sub cases.
1. Transfer of information so that the recipient may mail to a personal address as a single piece of mail
2. Transfer of information so that the recipient may send a package by mean including, but not restricted to the USPS
3. Transfer of information so that the recipient may include the address in a bulk mailing to a personal address
4. Transfer of information so that the recipient may mail a single piece of may to a business

Address is based upon USPS publication 28.
Pub-28 has two sections, format of an address on a piece of mail and data points that MAY compose an address.
The data point noun children of ADDRESS are the union components of an address on a piece of mail or a package.  The reciever of an address that uses it to format a mail label would need to appliy the formating requirements of pub-28.

For example: Pub 28 refers to the address "last line" as being composed of the City &lt;&lt;single space&gt;&gt;State&lt;&lt;single space&gt;&gt;ZIP. Insertion of the space seperators would be the responsibility of the mail sender system. The ADDRESS container holds the City, State and Postal code values.

Postal Code vs ZIP CODE
MISMO V2 used Postal Code, to to represent the possibility of the mail recipient being at an address outside the US. We will continue that distinction.

Pub-28 defines a mail format that is complient with the international mailing standard defined by the UPU.  Pub-28 points out that for mail that crosses internationl borders the format of the sending country should be used. The USPS international format is to have COUNTRY as the last line of the address on the piece of mail.  The ADDRESS container has a noun child data point for Country. It is the responiblity of the user of the data to plac to correct values on the piece of mail correctly.

The Investor Feature container holds investor-specific data that is either proprietary to the investor or does not decompose into other MISMO attributes. For example, this container could hold data on Fannie Mae’s Special Feature Codes or Future Feature Codes, or Freddie Mac’s Special Characteristics Codes.
An investor-specified name for a collection of features.
A text description of a loan feature not defined by other attributes.
An investor-specified identifier used to identify a loan feature not defined by other attributes.
An investor-specified name used to describe a loan feature not defined by other attributes.
An integer value used to provide an order to multi-instance sibling elements.

The Investor Feature container holds investor-specific data that is either proprietary to the investor or does not decompose into other MISMO attributes. For example, this container could hold data on Fannie Mae’s Special Feature Codes or Future Feature Codes, or Freddie Mac’s Special Characteristics Codes.

Data specific to the relationship between the seller and the investor, including the reporting and financial obligations between the seller, the servicer, and the investor. The structure also holds data on the investor’s interest in the Delivery Loan.

The guaranty fee rate prior to applying any adjustments, such as buyup/buydown. This can be specified in a price sheet, commitment, or other agreement. The guaranty fee is a portion of the interest on the loan that is paid to a party to ensure the timely payment of principal and interest to the holders of securities backed by the loan.

xsd:appinfo.$t: Renamed.  Used to be "Base Investor Guaranty Fee Rate".

xsd:documentation.$t: Identifies the collateral program associated with the loan as identified by a specific entity. The entity may be referenced using the OwnerURI attribute.
Indicates that servicing is transferred concurrent with loan delivery.
This describes the contractual accounting method used to calculate the funds received by the servicer from the borrower that are due to the investor.
Identifying the party who issued the variance code.
The description of the Contract Variance Code Issuer Type when Other is selected as the option from the enumerated list.
Specifies the type of execution through which the loan was purchased by an investor.
A free form text field used to collect additional information when Other is selected for Execution Type.
The day basis on which the exception interest adjustment is computed based on the servicing contract.
The day basis on which the funding interest adjustment is computed based on the purchase contract.
Indicates whether an eligible seller has elected the Add On or Post-Settlement delivery fees for a specific mortgage.

Contractual guaranty fee &&#35;40;after adjusting for the alternate payment method &&#35;40;APM&&#35;41; remittance cycle, if applicable&&#35;41; for an Mortgage Backed Security &&#35;40;MBS&&#35;41; pool mortgage.

The guaranty fee rate after applying all adjustments to the guaranty fee, such as buyup/buydown. The guaranty fee is a portion of the interest on the loan that is paid to a party to guarantee the timely payment of interest and principal to the holders of securities backed by the loan.

xsd:appinfo.$t: Renamed.  Used to be "Investor Guaranty Fee Rate".

xsd:documentation.$t: The maximum allowed dollar amount variance between the reported and the expected or scheduled interest.
Identifies the collateral program associated with the loan as identified by a specific entity. The entity may be referenced using the OwnerURI attribute.
The investors committed takeout price for a loan expressed as a precentage.
The unique identifier assigned by the investor to a single-family structured transaction.
A unique identifier that segregates loans for a specific investor according to defined characteristics, such as interest rate, service fee, pool, asset group, etc.

The investor guaranty fee rate after any addition or reduction to the base guaranty fee rate due to a guaranty fee buyup or buydown. The investor guaranty fee is a portion of the interest on the loan that is paid to a party to guarantee the timely payment of interest and principal to the holders of securities backed by the loan.

xsd:appinfo.$t: Renamed.  Use to be "Investor Guaranty Fee After Buyup Buydown Rate".

xsd:documentation.$t: The percentage of the Original Loan Balance that is being held as collateral by the investor for default costs on the loan.
Identifies the secondary mortgage market institution &&#35;40;investor&&#35;41; associated with the lender or trading partner.
The expiration date for an investor's commitment to acquire a loan.
Indicates that the investor waives the full prepayment penalties
The due date of the first payment to the investor.
Indicates that the investor waives the curtailment penalties

The unique identifier of the master commitment that states the terms under which a lender and an investor agree to deliver/receive mortgage loans in exchange for funds or securities. Identifies the percentage amount of the loan owned by the investor
Identifies the ownership status of the investor.
Specifies the investor identifier associated with the loan product being financed.
Field used in the pass through calculation when the Bottom Up method is used.
The day of the month on which principal and interest for the loan are remitted by the servicer to the investor.
This describes the contractual accounting method used to calculate the funds received by the servicer from the borrower that are due to the investor.
A free-form text field used to capture the Investor Remittance Type if Other is selected.
Specifies the reporting method required by the investor from the servicer.
The fixed dollar amount that is paid to the servicer by the investor for servicing the mortgage if the service fee is not expressed as a rate.
The percentage of interest collected that is paid to the servicer by the investor for servicing the mortgage &&#35;40;gross&&#35;41;

xsd:appinfo.$t: Renamed.  Used to be "Investor Service Fee Rate".

xsd:documentation.$t: Last principal balance reported to the investor
The number of days allowed for late delivery of the loan, beyond the scheduled delivery date.

The date the lender selects to have its whole loan purchase funded. Proceeds are typically wired to the lender 24 hours after the purchase of the loan. By selecting this date, the lender manages when the funds are to be wired.
The scheduled unpaid principal balance of the mortgage as of loan acquisition or the issue date of the associated security.
The number of basis points of loan-level buyup/buydown selected by the seller for this mortgage.
Specifies the type of buyup or buydown an eligible seller has elected to exercise for a specific mortgage.
A free-form text field used to provide additional information when Other is selected for Loan Buyup Buydown Type.
Indicates the party that bears the default loss for the loan.
The frequency that the servicer must report for loans that are in default.
The number of days after which a servicer can stop advancing funds on a delinquent loan.
The dollar amount disbursed under a loan agreement in advance of full funding.

xsd:appinfo.$t: Renamed.  Replaces "Loan Advanced Amount".

xsd:documentation.$t: The name of the legal entity from which the seller acquired the loan.
The difference between the dollar price paid for the loan and its UPB at the time of purchase when the UPB is less than price paid.
The difference between the dollar price paid for the loan and its UPB at the time of purchase when the UPB is more than price paid.
The number of basis points of servicing fee selected for this mortgage.
Indicates whether the seller will identify specific loan level servicing values for this mortgage.
Indicates that the transaction on the Investors side is a Purchase of servicing rights rather than the purchase of an asset.
A premium, expressed as a dollar amount, calculated based upon the difference between the interest rate of the loan and the market rate at the time of funding.
Determines what formula is used to calculate the investor pass through rate as defined in the investor contract.

xsd:appinfo.$t: Renamed.  Replaces "Investor Loan Arm Service Fee And Pass Through Calculation Method Type".

xsd:documentation.$t: Investor rate ceiling used in bottom up calculations.

xsd:appinfo.$t: Renamed.  Used to be "Pass Through Ceiling Rate".

xsd:documentation.$t: The rate at which interest is passed by the servicer to the investor. It equals the note rate less the service fee rate and excess service fee rate.

xsd:appinfo.$t: Renamed.  Used to be "Investor Pass Through Rate".

xsd:documentation.$t: The maximum allowed dollar amount variance between the reported and the expected or scheduled principal.
Identifier of a loan from a related or original transaction. May be used for modifications and conversion of existing loans.
Specifies the investor of the associated loan.
A free form text field used to collect additional information when Other is selected for Related Loan investor Type.
Identifies the party responsible for marketing the property in case of default.
A free form text field used to collect additional information when Other is selected for REO Marketing Party Type.
The minimum service fee rate, expressed as a percent, to be earned by the servicer.

xsd:appinfo.$t: Renamed.  Used to be "Service Fee Minimum Rate".

xsd:documentation.$t: The dollar amount that was paid by the seller to acquire the loan from a third party.
The maximum allowed dollar amount variance between the reported and the expected or scheduled unpaid principal balance &&#35;40;UPB&&#35;41;.
The dollar amount of the advance against a warehouse line of credit.
Uniquely identifies a subcategory of a warehouse commitment.

A domain name is an identification label that defines a realm of administrative autonomy, authority, or control in the Internet, based on the Domain Name System &&#35;40;DNS&&#35;41;. The Internet Corporation for Assigned Names and Numbers &&#35;40;ICANN&&#35;41; has overall responsibility for managing the DNS. Domain names are often seen in analogy to real estate in that &&#35;40;1&&#35;41; domain names are foundations on which a website &&#35;40;like a house or commercial building&&#35;41; can be built and &&#35;40;2&&#35;41; the highest "quality" domain names, like sought-after real estate, tend to carry significant value, usually due to their online brand-building potential, use in advertising, search engine optimization, and many other criteria. Because Domain names are registered it provides authoritaive identification of the leagl entity. the URI can be in URN or URL format.
Information about the Lender. A lender may be an Originating lender and NOT fund the loan &&#35;40;TPO&&#35;41;. A Lender may be the funds source.
The name of lenders associate who is responsible for ordering or drawing the loan documents.
This is a relationship between a contact at the lender and and order request.  This should be removed.
The name of lenders associate who is responsible for supervising the funding of the loan.

Identification of the lender funding the loan. The identification is as follows: FDIC-insured lenders indicate their FDIC Insurance Certificate Number; Federally-insured credit unions indicate their charter/insurance number; Farm Credit institutions indicate their UNINUM number. Other lenders who fund loans sold to or securitized by FNMA or FHLMC enter FNMA or FHLMC seller/servicer number.

Indicates a liability is to be paid using borrowers current assets, prior to closing, and not out of cash from closing.
The number of months the borrower must make payments in order to satisfy the identified liability. Collected on the URLA in Section VI &&#35;40;Liabilities - Mos. Left to Pay&&#35;41;.

Specifies the other liability type when Other is selected.

Indicates whether the liability will be re-subordinated to the subject loan after closing.

The Map Element contains or points to stylesheets for generating or populating document views based on the contents of the DATA and/or SIGNATORY elements. The resulting View is used to replace a View containing outdated data or to verify that the data in the target View matches the data provided in the SIGNATORY and DATA elements.

Contains or points to an unpopulated version of the view which has all form fields marked and identified so that it can be run thru a TRANSFORM to populate those fields with data. When the TEMPLATE element is present, then a TRANSFORM element must also be provided. If a TEMPLATE element is not provided, then TRANSFORMS must contain both the boiler plate of the view as well as the code for populating its forms fields.

Contains a collection of TRANSFORM elements. If multiple transform elements are provided, then each one of them must executed in sequence with the output one transform serving as the input to next one.

MESSAGE is the root node for V3. It represents the message payload of any SOAP or REST transaction.  In SOAP MESSAGE is the content of &lt;soap:body&gt;.  In REST MESSSAGE is the document that is in the PUT, GET or DELETE HTTP protocol methods.

The MISMO Reference Model Identifier is a unique value that represents the version of the MISMO reference model to which the containing XML instance document complies. For detailed information, please see MISMO Engineering Guide 006 – “Versioning and Release Schedule”, at http://wiki.mismo.org/MISMO.Wiki/Wiki.jsp?page=Meg0006

A Class word of Amount SHOULD identify a data point that is an amount of money. It SHALL NOT contain any punctuation other than the decimal point or sign values. The decimal point is ALWAYS the US nationalization character &&#35;40;.&&#35;41; in the designated character encoding &&#35;40;UTF-8 assumed when not stated &&#35;41;
EXAMPLE:For example an Unpaid Principle Balance of $100,000.12 would be expressed as 100000.12.

anyURI represents a Uniform Resource Identifier Reference &&#35;40;URI&&#35;41;. An anyURI value can be absolute or relative, and may have an optional fragment identifier &&#35;40;i.e., it may be a URI Reference&&#35;41;. This type should be used to specify the intention that the value fulfills the role of a URI as defined by [RFC 2396], as amended by [RFC 2732].

Lexical representation
The ·lexical space· of anyURI is finite-length character sequences which, when the algorithm defined in Section 5.4 of [XML Linking Language] is applied to them, result in strings which are legal URIs according to [RFC 2396], as amended by [RFC 2732]. 

Note:  Spaces are, in principle, allowed in the ·lexical space· of anyURI, however, their use is highly discouraged &&#35;40;unless they are encoded by %20&&#35;41;.

xsd:appinfo.$t:
Full dates MUST be represented in the extended format YYYY-MM-DD
YYYY is a four-digit year, “0000” through “9999”
MM is a two-digit month of that year, “01” through “12”
DD is a two-digit day of that month, “01” through “31”
Padded zeros must be used.
- is the required separator between YYYY-MM-DD

The Collection of Address related data points that are used in many contexts.The Collection of Address related data points that are used in many contexts.
The primary use case for this container is to support mailling material to the address.
V2 ADDRESS container was implicitly a mailing container, V3 will be explicitly for mail.
With in this use case there are sub cases.
1. Transfer of information so that the recipient may mail to a personal address as a single piece of mail
2. Transfer of information so that the recipient may send a package by mean including, but not restricted to the USPS
3. Transfer of information so that the recipient may include the address in a bulk mailing to a personal address
4. Transfer of information so that the recipient may mail a single piece of may to a business

Address is based upon USPS publication 28.
Pub-28 has two sections, format of an address on a piece of mail and data points that MAY compose an address.
The data point noun children of ADDRESS are the union components of an address on a piece of mail or a package.  The reciever of an address that uses it to format a mail label would need to appliy the formating requirements of pub-28.

For example: Pub 28 refers to the address "last line" as being composed of the City &lt;&lt;single space&gt;&gt;State&lt;&lt;single space&gt;&gt;ZIP. Insertion of the space seperators would be the responsibility of the mail sender system. The ADDRESS container holds the City, State and Postal code values.

Postal Code vs ZIP CODE
MISMO V2 used Postal Code, to to represent the possibility of the mail recipient being at an address outside the US. We will continue that distinction.

Pub-28 defines a mail format that is complient with the international mailing standard defined by the UPU.  Pub-28 points out that for mail that crosses internationl borders the format of the sending country should be used. The USPS international format is to have COUNTRY as the last line of the address on the piece of mail.  The ADDRESS container has a noun child data point for Country. It is the responiblity of the user of the data to plac to correct values on the piece of mail correctly.

NEED TO IDENTIFY THE NAME OF THE FIELDS IN THE PUB 28 WHEN MISMO CHOOSES TO DIVERT

Address is based upon USPS publication 28.
Pub-28 has two sections, format of an address on a piece of mail and data points that MAY compose an address.
The data point noun children of ADDRESS are the union components of an address on a piece of mail or a package.  The reciever of an address that uses it to format a mail label would need to appliy the formating requirements of pub-28.

For example: Pub 28 refers to the address "last line" as being composed of the City &lt;&lt;single space&gt;&gt;State&lt;&lt;single space&gt;&gt;ZIP. Insertion of the space seperators would be the responsibility of the mail sender system. The ADDRESS container holds the City, State and Postal code values.

Postal Code vs ZIP CODE
MISMO V2 used Postal Code, to to represent the possibility of the mail recipient being at an address outside the US. We will continue that distinction.

Pub-28 defines a mail format that is complient with the international mailing standard defined by the UPU.  Pub-28 points out that for mail that crosses internationl borders the format of the sending country should be used. The USPS international format is to have COUNTRY as the last line of the address on the piece of mail.  The ADDRESS container has a noun child data point for Country. It is the responiblity of the user of the data to plac to correct values on the piece of mail correctly.

Used to identify the alternate location of content. Used to reduce the redundancy of a message by placing common content in a alternative location and replacing it with the REFERENCE element that points to that location. A message recipient MAY replace the content of the referenced location for the REFERENCE element before processing or may process the information from that location. Processing XML encryption or XML signature will ALWAYS require replacement of the REFERENCE element with the content or the referenced location. The referenced location MAY be internal to the current XML document or it MAY be external. When internal there WILL NOT be a LocationURI child element. The referenced content MAY or MAY NOT be located at a place other than the root element of the external location.  If it is NOT the root element the LocationXPath child element identifies the location within the located XML document. For an external reference the LocationXPath is ALWAYS and absolute path from the document root. For and internal reference the LocationXPath child element value MAY absolute of relative.

The Collection of Address related data points that are used in many contexts.The Collection of Address related data points that are used in many contexts.
The primary use case for this container is to support mailling material to the address.
V2 ADDRESS container was implicitly a mailing container, V3 will be explicitly for mail.
With in this use case there are sub cases.
1. Transfer of information so that the recipient may mail to a personal address as a single piece of mail
2. Transfer of information so that the recipient may send a package by mean including, but not restricted to the USPS
3. Transfer of information so that the recipient may include the address in a bulk mailing to a personal address
4. Transfer of information so that the recipient may mail a single piece of may to a business

Address is based upon USPS publication 28.
Pub-28 has two sections, format of an address on a piece of mail and data points that MAY compose an address.
The data point noun children of ADDRESS are the union components of an address on a piece of mail or a package.  The reciever of an address that uses it to format a mail label would need to appliy the formating requirements of pub-28.

For example: Pub 28 refers to the address "last line" as being composed of the City &lt;&lt;single space&gt;&gt;State&lt;&lt;single space&gt;&gt;ZIP. Insertion of the space seperators would be the responsibility of the mail sender system. The ADDRESS container holds the City, State and Postal code values.

Postal Code vs ZIP CODE
MISMO V2 used Postal Code, to to represent the possibility of the mail recipient being at an address outside the US. We will continue that distinction.

Pub-28 defines a mail format that is complient with the international mailing standard defined by the UPU.  Pub-28 points out that for mail that crosses internationl borders the format of the sending country should be used. The USPS international format is to have COUNTRY as the last line of the address on the piece of mail.  The ADDRESS container has a noun child data point for Country. It is the responiblity of the user of the data to plac to correct values on the piece of mail correctly.

xsd:documentation.$t: Used to identify the alternate location of content. Used to reduce the redundancy of a message by placing common content in a alternative location and replacing it with the REFERENCE element that points to that location. A message recipient MAY replace the content of the referenced location for the REFERENCE element before processing or may process the information from that location. Processing XML encryption or XML signature will ALWAYS require replacement of the REFERENCE element with the content or the referenced location. The referenced location MAY be internal to the current XML document or it MAY be external. When internal there WILL NOT be a LocationURI child element. The referenced content MAY or MAY NOT be located at a place other than the root element of the external location.  If it is NOT the root element the LocationXPath child element identifies the location within the located XML document. For an external reference the LocationXPath is ALWAYS and absolute path from the document root. For and internal reference the LocationXPath child element value MAY absolute of relative.
The URL where the resource may be found when the location is external to the current XML document.

The Collection of Address related data points that are used in many contexts.The Collection of Address related data points that are used in many contexts.
The primary use case for this container is to support mailling material to the address.
V2 ADDRESS container was implicitly a mailing container, V3 will be explicitly for mail.
With in this use case there are sub cases.
1. Transfer of information so that the recipient may mail to a personal address as a single piece of mail
2. Transfer of information so that the recipient may send a package by mean including, but not restricted to the USPS
3. Transfer of information so that the recipient may include the address in a bulk mailing to a personal address
4. Transfer of information so that the recipient may mail a single piece of may to a business

Address is based upon USPS publication 28.
Pub-28 has two sections, format of an address on a piece of mail and data points that MAY compose an address.
The data point noun children of ADDRESS are the union components of an address on a piece of mail or a package.  The reciever of an address that uses it to format a mail label would need to appliy the formating requirements of pub-28.

For example: Pub 28 refers to the address "last line" as being composed of the City &lt;&lt;single space&gt;&gt;State&lt;&lt;single space&gt;&gt;ZIP. Insertion of the space seperators would be the responsibility of the mail sender system. The ADDRESS container holds the City, State and Postal code values.

Postal Code vs ZIP CODE
MISMO V2 used Postal Code, to to represent the possibility of the mail recipient being at an address outside the US. We will continue that distinction.

Pub-28 defines a mail format that is complient with the international mailing standard defined by the UPU.  Pub-28 points out that for mail that crosses internationl borders the format of the sending country should be used. The USPS international format is to have COUNTRY as the last line of the address on the piece of mail.  The ADDRESS container has a noun child data point for Country. It is the responiblity of the user of the data to plac to correct values on the piece of mail correctly.

The Collection of Address related data points that are used in many contexts.The Collection of Address related data points that are used in many contexts.
The primary use case for this container is to support mailling material to the address.
V2 ADDRESS container was implicitly a mailing container, V3 will be explicitly for mail.
With in this use case there are sub cases.
1. Transfer of information so that the recipient may mail to a personal address as a single piece of mail
2. Transfer of information so that the recipient may send a package by mean including, but not restricted to the USPS
3. Transfer of information so that the recipient may include the address in a bulk mailing to a personal address
4. Transfer of information so that the recipient may mail a single piece of may to a business

Address is based upon USPS publication 28.
Pub-28 has two sections, format of an address on a piece of mail and data points that MAY compose an address.
The data point noun children of ADDRESS are the union components of an address on a piece of mail or a package.  The reciever of an address that uses it to format a mail label would need to appliy the formating requirements of pub-28.

For example: Pub 28 refers to the address "last line" as being composed of the City &lt;&lt;single space&gt;&gt;State&lt;&lt;single space&gt;&gt;ZIP. Insertion of the space seperators would be the responsibility of the mail sender system. The ADDRESS container holds the City, State and Postal code values.

Postal Code vs ZIP CODE
MISMO V2 used Postal Code, to to represent the possibility of the mail recipient being at an address outside the US. We will continue that distinction.

Pub-28 defines a mail format that is complient with the international mailing standard defined by the UPU.  Pub-28 points out that for mail that crosses internationl borders the format of the sending country should be used. The USPS international format is to have COUNTRY as the last line of the address on the piece of mail.  The ADDRESS container has a noun child data point for Country. It is the responiblity of the user of the data to plac to correct values on the piece of mail correctly.

NEED TO IDENTIFY THE NAME OF THE FIELDS IN THE PUB 28 WHEN MISMO CHOOSES TO DIVERT

The STAKEHOLDER_SIGNATURE_FIELD element describes a group of areas in the view that collectively represent a signature of a stakeholder. A stakeholder is any signer of a document who is not a notary or a witness on that document; for example a borrower, a lender or seller. Points to the area of the view that contains the visual representation of a party’s signature.

xsd:documentation.$t: The FIELD_REFERENCE type is a group of XML fields used for indentifying the area of the view described by a VIEW_FIELD element. The preferred method is to use the FieldPlaceHolderIdentifier. When that is not supported by the view format, then the field is identified by its XY coordinates using the other elements in this XML type.

A FOREIGN_OBJECT can be Encoded in a variety of manners without changing its underlying meaning. However, the Encoding of EmbeddedContentXML MUST result in a schema-valid representation. Contains or points to a series of instructions for populating the view based on the data and template provided in the document or for generating the view from scratch based only on the data. The behavior of the TRANSFORM depends upon the presence of the TEMPLATE element. If a TEMPLATE element is provided, then the TRANSFORM merges the data in the DATA element with the template to produce a new populated view. If the TEMPLATE element is not provided, then the TRANSFORM generates the complete view from scratch based on provided data.

Information regarding land with boundaries that are determined by metes & bounds descriptions based on references to known Township, Range and Section corners.
MAL: 04_22_2008

A unique number &&#35;40;or alpha-numeric designator&&#35;41; assigned to a land title abstract &&#35;40;i.e.: a sequential collection of documents relating to a specific parcel of land&&#35;41;.  The boundaries of a parcel of real property is determined from the information contained in the abstract.
An Identifier, usually a number, for an abstract document which describes a parcel of land.

The Government Survey Base coordinate of the property that is the east-west line from which to measure Township lines &&#35;40;six [6] miles apart&&#35;41; north or south of the base line. For example: Township 2 North, Range 2 West measured from a Base and Meridian point.
A tract identifier used to legally identify a property. This identifier may be different than the census tract identifier.

xsd:appinfo.$t: Renamed.  Used to be "Property Tract Identifier".

xsd:documentation.$t: The Government survey Meridian of the property is the north-south line from which to measure Range lines east and west of the Meridian, or starting point.

The text of the remaining portion of a Metes and Bounds description after indexing information is populated into the other data fields. 

For example: Commencing 96.8 rods North and 155 rods West from the Southeast corner of Section 11, Township 1 South, Range 1 West, Salt Lake Meridian, West 105.495 feet; thence South 98 feet; thence West 60 feet; thence South 34 feet; thence East 10.03 rods; thence North 8 rods to the point of beginning. 
There are two other terms that often appear in metes and bounds descriptions: a chain, which is approximately 66 feet, and a rod which is approximately one-quarter of a chain or 16.5 feet.

Surveying Sections &&#35;40;one mile by one mile&&#35;41; are divided into quarters that are half-mile by half-mile &&#35;40;160 acre&&#35;41; squares.  These are identifed as the Northeast, Northwest, Southwest & Southeast quarter sections.  Quarter sections can also be divded into individual quarters resulting in quarter-quarter sections containing 40 acres.

Surveying demarkations used in the Public Land Survey System. Range lines run north & south so as to measure east and west distances in columns.  Range lines are spaced every six &&#35;40;6&&#35;41; miles.  Commonly used in a grid along with Township and Section to describe an area of land at the county level.

xsd:appinfo.$t: Renamed.  Use to be "Property Range Identifier".

xsd:documentation.$t: The thirty-six &&#35;40;36&&#35;41; square miles outlined by a surveying township.  Sections are numbered boustrophedonically &&#35;40;right to left then dropping down a row and continuing left to right&&#35;41; beginning in the northeast section.  Each Section contains 640 acres.

xsd:appinfo.$t: Renamed.  Use to be "Property Section Identifier".

xsd:documentation.$t:
&&#35;40;1&&#35;41; Surveying demarkations used in the Public Land Survey System.  Town lines run east & west so as to measure north & south distances in rows.  Town lines are spaced every six miles.  Commonly used in a grid along with Range and Section to describe an area of land at the county level.

&&#35;40;2&&#35;41; The resulting 6 mile by six mile square is referred to as a surveying township.  This may or may not align with political townships.

xsd:appinfo.$t: Renamed.  Use to be "Property Township Identifier".

The VIEW element contains the visual representation of the document. Each VIEW element contains a visual representation of the document at a given point in its lifecycle. Document processors may create new VIEW elements when there is a need to effect a change to the view but the previous version has to be preserved because of legal constraints, technical limitations or other reasons. Each view element contains a complete, standalone visual representation of the document. The first VIEW element created in the DOCUMENT must have a SequenceNumber  with the value 1. Each subsequent element must have the sequence number of the previous element plus 1. The VIEW element with the highest sequence identifier is the current version of the view.

The VIEW_FILES element contains the VIEW_FILE elements used to compose a view of the document. The VIEW_FILE element with SequenceNumber equal to 1 is the starting point for viewing, the others are secondary or additional resources. As another example, in an XHTML view the first VIEW_FILE may be the main file and the others may be secondary VIEW_FILE elements referenced by the main file.
The VIEW_FIELDS element is a collection of field definitions.
An integer value used to provide an order to multi-instance sibling elements.
The VIEWS element contains a list of VIEW elements.

The VIEW element contains the visual representation of the document. Each VIEW element contains a visual representation of the document at a given point in its lifecycle. Document processors may create new VIEW elements when there is a need to effect a change to the view but the previous version has to be preserved because of legal constraints, technical limitations or other reasons. Each view element contains a complete, standalone visual representation of the document. The first VIEW element created in the DOCUMENT must have a SequenceNumber  with the value 1. Each subsequent element must have the sequence number of the previous element plus 1. The VIEW element with the highest sequence identifier is the current version of the view.

The FIELD_REFERENCE type is a group of XML fields used for indentifying the area of the view described by a VIEW_FIELD element. The preferred method is to use the FieldPlaceHolderIdentifier. When that is not supported by the view format, then the field is identified by its XY coordinates using the other elements in this XML type.
The NOTARY_SIGNATURE_FIELD element describes a group of areas in the view that comprise a notary certificate and signature.

The FIELD_REFERENCE type is a group of XML fields used for indentifying the area of the view described by a VIEW_FIELD element. The preferred method is to use the FieldPlaceHolderIdentifier. When that is not supported by the view format, then the field is identified by its XY coordinates using the other elements in this XML type.
The RECORDING_ENDORSEMENT_FIELD describes an area of the view to be filled out with the recording endorsement.

The STAKEHOLDER_SIGNATURE_FIELD element describes a group of areas in the view that collectively represent a signature of a stakeholder. A stakeholder is any signer of a document who is not a notary or a witness on that document; for example a borrower, a lender or seller. Points to the area of the view that contains the visual representation of a party’s signature.
The WITNESS_SIGNATURE_FIELD element describes an area of the view that contains the appearance of a witness signature.
An integer value used to provide an order to multi-instance sibling elements.
The VIEW_FIELDS element is a collection of field definitions.

Certificates issued by financial institutions with a stated term or interest rate, and with a set maturity date. The bank pays the holder in due course at maturity. Early withdrawal subject to penalty. Considered liquid. Collected on the URLA in Section V

Proceeds from a loan secured by borrowers assets, which have not yet been deposited to borrowers accounts or included with other assets disclosed. Considered liquid. Collected on the URLA in Section VI &&#35;40;Assets - Other Assets&&#35;41;.

Financial instrument evidencing an ownership interest in entity that issued the stock. Typical valuation method is Market. Collected on the URLA in Section VI &&#35;40;Assets - Stocks & Bonds&&#35;41;.
