Informs the borrower of any Lender-related businesses &&#35;40;i.e., subsidiaries or affiliates&&#35;41; and borrower options related to using these providers. This document is a part of HUD Regulation X &&#35;40;RESPA/Reg X&&#35;41;.
Confirms that a borrower is aware of presence of airport and possible noise situations. Provided by Borrower.

Adds HUD required conditions to the Purchase Agreement. Escape clause allowing a borrower to exit transaction if it does not meet value.  These do not have HUD number but are required in Purchase Agreement.
Describes interest and principal payments to a borrower from a lender, or lender to borrower, and their effect on the balance of the loan.
Confirms that the appraised value of a home has not decreased.
Describes findings of the appraisal process and provides an estimation of the subject property value.  Provided by a qualified appraiser.
Documents the results of a independent evaluation of an appraisal
Requests an internal review and evaluation of an appraisal.
Describes the loan approval status and any associated conditions to the borrower.
Establishes a corporation's purpose and structure, and percentages of ownership.
Transfers the beneficial interest in a instrument from one party to another.
Establishes that the buyer will assume responsibility for the obligations of a mortgage from the builder or original owner.
Describes escrowed repairs and certifies that escrowed repairs will be completed.  Provided by Lender.

Confirms that a person is under a Power of Attorney and warrants specifics facts about the person such as: POA has not been revoked, principle has not died, no divorce action has been commenced if spouse of the principle, a guardian or conservator has not been appointed for the Principle.

Addresses trust or other property matters and confirms the legality of the information that is being provided to the lender.  This could consist of beneficiary information, assets used as collateral, trustee and revocable nature of trusts. In Some States, Title insurance is provided via an Attorney's Opinion  Letter.
Establishes a direct debit from a borrowers account for loan or escrow payment.
Confirms results from Desk Top Underwriter, Loan Prospector or other underwriting system, including the loan decision and conditions or stipulations of the approval.
Confirms results from an automated property valuation system.
Confirms that a company will return to the funding lender the collateral package, the funded value, or mortgage-backed security value of a property.
Informs borrower of what will happen when lender is instructed to pay off debt on behalf of a borrower directly from a Home Equity account.
Informs the borrower that rate and payment amount may change when the refinance option is chosen for balloon loans and describes how the interest rate and payments are determined.
Provides written evidence of a deposit to a financial institution.
Confirms that a person or company is legally free and clear to repay certain debts.  Provided by the court.
Describes transactions recorded and account balances of a customer's accounts during a specified period.
Outlines the details for distribution of funds from a benefit plan.
Describes required home repairs or improvements and provides an estimation of cost to complete.
Confirms details about an individual's birth.  An official record provided by a government entity such as a state, county, city or borough.
Confirms the ownership of a bond.
Confirms that the borrowers understand the condition of the property.

Describes items related to the application including borrower credit, income, employment or assets. Typically provided by borrower.  Includes items provided by third parties in support of the borrower's application. Documents provided by the lender to be signed by the borrower are not considered Borrower Correspondence.
Authorizes lender to request personal information on the borrower's behalf.
Certification that the borrower will not use a multiple dwelling property for hotel or transient housing.
Verifies that there are no outstanding liens or mortgages that would not allow for the appropriate lien position of a new loan.
Describes sources and amounts of compensation a brokered mortgage transaction.  Provided by Broker to Borrower.

Describes findings of the broker review process and provides an estimation of the subject property value.  The report typically combines information from a drive-by exterior examination, and various external data sources, but not an interior examination.
Confirms that the property construction is completed to requirements. Provided by builder.
Authorizes the builder to build on the property. Provided by local municipal authority.
Authorizes the legal operation of a business in an area issued by the state or municipality.
Establishes a rate variant, or temporary adjustment, of interest rate on the loan.  Used to reduce, or step down, an interest rate.
Describes the settlement process, charges, rights and remedies available under RESPA, as well as explanation of settlement services and costs.
Confirms that a property is no longer listed with a real estate agent.
Represents money payable or paid &&#35;40;if cancelled&&#35;41;.
Describes the list of action items, steps, or elements required to be consulted or completed to accomplish a task.
Describes the legal obligation of a parent to pay money toward the care and maintenance of his/her children.
Requests that a line of credit be closed after receiving a payoff under a separate cover.
Describes the conditions that must be met in order to complete the closing. Provided by Lender to Closing Agent.
Establishes that the borrower will accommodate changes to loan documentation that result from errors and omissions, to ensure that the documents conform to industry standards.

Confirms that property construction, repairs or improvements related to the loan &&#35;40;but not to the appraisal per se&&#35;41; have been completed acceptably.  Provided by appraiser or inspector. This is not Fannie Mae form 442.  Ref HUD form 92051.
Establishes the property value and describes repair conditions.  Provided by Underwriter. This is only related to appraisal and property.
Confirms the percentage of a Condominium &&#35;40;Condo&&#35;41; Association or phase is currently occupied.
Authorizes a person to sign documents for a borrower.
Changes one or more of the terms of a mortgagor's loan in the security instrument.  Used for refinance loans in state of NY.
Describes in detail the construction costs to build a new structure.
Describes Adjustable Rate Mortgages and reviews their benefits and risks.
Transfers title to a property from a seller &&#35;40;grantor&&#35;41; to a recipient &&#35;40;grantee&&#35;41;; provides evidence of the legal right of ownership.
Contains data about the property sale and conveyance tax calculations. Accompanies a Conveyance Deed at the time of recording.
Establishes the rules for governing and operating the Cooperative &&#35;40;Coop&&#35;41; Housing Corporation.
Describes the planned revenues and expenditures of the Cooperative &&#35;40;Coop&&#35;41; for the current fiscal year.
Establishes the rights and duties of the Cooperative &&#35;40;Coop&&#35;41; and member shareholder under which the shareholder is allowed to use a certain unit in the premises.
Establishes the responsibility of the Cooperative &&#35;40;Coop&&#35;41;  to notify the lender in the event of borrower default.
Confirms an individual's ownership interest in the Cooperative.
Authorizes the lender to assign the borrowers stock certificate in case of default.
Informs a cosigner of a loan that they will be obligated to pay the debt if the main borrower's&&#35;41; default on the loan.
Confirms that the property was constructed to CABO &&#35;40;Council of American Building Officials&&#35;41; standards. Provided by builder.
Confirms that the borrower participated in homeownership counseling.
Informs the borrower of certain Veterans' Affairs items of interest regarding the loan and financing eligibility.

Confirms results from the HUD Credit Alert Interactive Voice Response System, which indicates whether the individual is in default on direct or guaranteed federal loans or are otherwise ineligible for an FHA loan.  Result is transcribed or captured as a screen-print from the HUD website.
Authorizes a company to use a client's credit card for mortgage related charges.  Generally these charges consist of credit report and appraisal fee.
Establishes the rates and charges incurred for credit insurance.
Describes the borrowers credit history. Provided by a credit reporting bureau, or a service which consolidates reports from multiple sources into a single report &&#35;40;Tri-merge&&#35;41;.

Verifies the identity of any person seeking to open an account; maintains records of the information used to verify the person’s identity; and  determines whether the person appears on any lists of known or suspected terrorists.
Confirms the date, location and cause of a person's death.  Issued by a government official.
Establishes the terms of the divorce.  Provided by a court or legal authority.
Establishes a repeatable direct deposit of funds into an account of a borrower. Used by servicing.
Determines loan amount for Energy Efficient Mortgage loan &&#35;40;loan to finance repairs that increase energy efficiency of the home&&#35;41;. Required by HUD.  Provided by Underwriter.
Informs the borrower that all consumers are entitled to an equal chance to obtain credit.
Establishes escrow accounts for taxes and insurance. Agreement between borrower and lender.
Establishes work to be completed on a property and the terms under which the funds for the work will be released.
Confirms work on the property has been completed and any funds held in escrow can be released.

Confirms the lender agrees to waive collecting a monthly payment for taxes and insurance &&#35;40;escrow or impound account&&#35;41;. Informs the applicant of their responsibilities to pay tax/insurance bills when due, whether an escrow waiver fee will be imposed, and information regarding lender placement of insurance.
Informs the borrower of estimated loan closing costs.
Establishes that certain statements of fact are correct as of the date of the statement and can be relied upon by a third party &&#35;40;including a prospective lender or purchaser&&#35;41;.

Informs the borrower of their credit score, range of possible scores, key factors affecting score, reporting agencies used, contacts for obtaining a report copy, and includes a statement that terms offered are based on consumer report information.
Informs the borrower that it is illegal to discriminate in lending practices. This is different that the Equal Credit Opportunity Act.
Informs the borrower that the lender is offering an insurance product or annuity in connection with an extension of credit.
Informs the borrower that the lender is selling credit insurance as part of the loan transaction.
Confirms that the borrower waives the requirement to receive the Notice to Homebuyer five days before closing.
Confirms that a borrower is not recorded on the LDP/GSA &&#35;40;Limited Denial of Participation/General Services Administration&&#35;41; lists, and therefore is eligible for an FHA loan.
Determines the appropriate amount for an FHA streamlined refinance loan.
Determines the appropriate amount for an FHA loan.
Confirms that all requirements have been met prior to FHA foreclosure. Provided to FHA.
Determines loan amount for refinance loan, included with or attached to the MCAW.  Required by HUD, provided by Underwriter.
Describes financial performance of a business or individual.
Informs the borrower that flood insurance may be required by the lender.
Establishes that a borrower will maintain flood insurance in the amount prescribed by the lender for the duration of the loan term.
Confirms that a borrower has received the information that the borrower should consider a home inspection.
Confirms that a loan meets Freddie Mac streamlined refinance criteria. Provided to Freddie Mac.
Confirms final closing information and numbers on a brokered or third party closing.

Confirms receipt of all the disclosures in the Disclosure Booklet,  HUD Guide to Settlement Costs. Also used to document the float/lock rate requests and mortgage insurance requests and provide the Appraisal Notice to the borrower.
Confirms that the borrower is receiving all or part of the down payment as a gift.  Provided by gift donor.

Describes the approximate costs borrower will pay at or before settlement, based on common practice in the locality. The mortgage banker or mortgage broker, if any, must deliver or mail the GFE to the applicant within three business days after the application is received. This document is a part of HUD Regulation X &&#35;40;RESPA/Reg X&&#35;41;.
Establishes participation and terms in a Group Savings Plan.
Determines whether the loan is high cost or predatory based on state or national statutes.
Agrees to hold harmless and indemnify &&#35;40;assumes the legal liability of&&#35;41; the lender from any future liability on items defined in the notice.
Confirms that the borrower has completed a homebuyer education program.  The program are usually in association with first time homebuyer and affordable housing programs.
Informs the borrower that the costs associated with the new HECM loan will not exceed the loan amount.
Confirms that a borrower will choose an FHA Insured HECM loan. Provided by the Lender.
Confirms that a borrower has met with a lending representative, in person, at some point during the HECM loan origination process.
Informs the borrower of right to waive HECM counseling requirements if the original loan is originated within five years of the preceding loan.
Establishes additional time to sell a property associated with a Home Equity Conversion Mortgage.
Describes final loan information and figures in a HECM transaction.
Informs the borrower of the steps to take if payment is not received from the HECM lender.
Describes the charges associated with the HECM loan and the payments made to the borrower.
Authorizes lender to freeze a Home Equity Line of Credit in anticipation of a pay off.
Confirms the property meets HUD requirements. Provided by the Condominium Association.
Confirms the correct borrower name to be used in executing the documents.
Informs the borrower about identify theft and how to protect one's credit.
Informs the borrower that the application as submitted is incomplete and establishes a time period in which information must be received.
Describes the funds available through a program that matches funds of the borrower deposited for the sole purpose of purchasing a residence.
Estimates the amount and activity in the escrow account based on anticipated future payments.
Discloses the interest rate and discount points to the borrower and are an agreement between the borrower and the lender. The Veteran's Affairs does not govern the rate or points on the loan.
Provides bill which itemizes nature and cost of transactions.
Confirms the amount of interest a person has paid on a mortgage.
Confirms a person’s non-salary income.
Confirms a person's wage income and taxes withheld.
Confirms the individual is a foreign tax resident.
Provides the borrowers tax identification number and certifies truthfulness of data provided.  Provided by borrower via IRS W9 form.
Describes the finance charges associated with the mortgage loan. May be included in the Truth in Lending disclosure.
Evidences an obligation determined by a decree of a court.
Establishes the interest in land of a person who owns the lease granted by the property owner.
Establishes the rights of others over an individual's &&#35;40;the Testator's&&#35;41; property after the individual's death.

Describes the physical location of the property as defined in the country records.  This is primarily a component of other documents &&#35;40;i.e. security instruments, title policies, commitments&&#35;41;, but is received separately on some occasions.
Informs the borrower or a third party, information from, or about, the lender. This is other then a federal, state, or local requirements or regulations.
Specifies agreement between a company and an individual to pay a pre-determined amount of money to a beneficiary if the insured dies during the policy term.
Describes in detail the budget for the construction of a home.

Provides information about a prospective borrower's employment, income, assets, debts and other financial information.  Includes information about the purpose of the home loan and about the property securing the home loan. Provided by Borrower with lender's assistance.
Informs the borrower of total finance charges and interest rates associated with the loan.
Provides Lender with information to determine the amount required to pay off an account and the outstanding principle balance as of a specific date.
Describes transactions recorded and account balances of a customers accounts during a specified period.
Summarizes key loan origination information including; pricing, product, contact and payment information; does not include credit decision.
Proves the ownership of the manufactured home and shows any liens on the property. Lists the manufacturer, serial numbers, and date of manufacture.
Confirms that a marriage has occurred.
Confirms that a person served in the military and describes their veterans status.
Establishes a commitment to issue mortgage insurance pending specified conditions.
Confirms existence of the insurance policy protecting the lender against loss from the borrower's failure to make payments on the mortgage loan.
Explains terms, requirements, or costs of mortgage insurance.
Changes one or more of the terms of the Mortgage Insurance Certificate after closing.
Identifies the borrower's nearest living relative.
Confirms that a person is not a diplomat, in the case where the person is a non-resident alien.
Establishes a legal obligation of the borrower to repay the debt secured by the mortgage.
Adds the specific terms of the ARM to the promissory note.
Adds additional page&&#35;40;s&&#35;41; to the Note for endorsements.
Changes one or more of the terms of a mortgagor's loan in the note and in the security instrument.
Changes one or more of the terms of the loan in the promissory note.
Informs the borrower of denial or other material change in the loan application.
Changes &&#35;40;updates&&#35;41; a previous appraisal that was prepared subject to completion of repairs or incomplete items.
Informs the borrower of their three-day right to cancel the loan application.  Required by TILA / Reg Z.
Informs the borrower of their right to a copy of their appraisal report.
Informs the borrower of the repair conditions listed on the Notice to Lender form, outlining any issues or comments on the appraisal. Provided by the lender to the borrower.
Describes repair conditions on the subject property. Provided by Appraiser to the lender. Provided as an addendum to Appraisal.
Establishes the borrower intends to occupy the property.
Confirms that a property is fit for occupancy.  Provided by local municipal authority.
To be used with TypeOtherDescription data point to describe a document not already on this list.
Releases a specific parcel of real property from an existing security instrument.
Establishes the terms of a partnership, including the rights and responsibilities of the partners.
Describes history of payments on a loan.
Describes the terms of a loan and loan payments, often emphasizing timing and amount of the first payment.
Confirms the remaining principle balance of a loan that is being paid off or refinanced, based on a defined close or pay date.
Describes income for a particular pay period.
Confirms a person's permanent legal residency.
Confirms a person's identity for the purposes of a government-regulated activity &&#35;40;such as driving or international travel&&#35;41;.  Provided by the controlling governmental authority.
Describes personal property and provides and estimation of value.
Authorizes one person to act as agent or attorney on behalf of another person.
Informs the borrower of appraisal and credit report fees. A state disclosure.
Informs a perspective borrowers that they will qualify for a loan based on the income and credit information the borrower has provided.
Informs the borrower of "premium pricing option" &&#35;40;i.e., option of prepayment charge in lieu of  higher interest rate&&#35;41;.
Informs the borrower of privacy rights; describes what information will be collected and shared.

Describes the condition of the subject property, or any of a variety of building systems or interior or exterior elements of the structure, or aspects of the surrounding property &&#35;40;such as water or soil&&#35;41;.
Establishes a commitment to issue property insurance pending payment.

Describes the information regarding the risk covered by the insurance policy, including the name of the insurance company,  its address, name of the policy holder, starting and ending dates of coverage, the actual coverage given in the contract, including locations and amounts.
Establishes the terms and conditions of the contract for insurance covering the subject property.
Explains lenders right to approve a borrower's choice of insurance company and the required specifics of the insurance such as deductible, premium and term.
Establishes the terms and conditions for purchase of a property.

Establishes that the lender and borrower have fixed &&#35;40;locked&&#35;41; specific terms of the loan application &&#35;40;including points, fees, expiration and product type&&#35;41; for a specified period.
Establishes that the borrower will reinstitute a mortgage debt after bankruptcy proceedings are completed.
Confirms the payment or exchange of a good or service.
Conveys a trustee's interest back to the property owner when a deed of trust is paid in full. In some jurisdictions both a Satisfaction of Deed of Trust and a Reconveyance.
Describes terms and conditions of the relocation package.

Establishes the terms between a relocation company and an employee to purchase a home based on the appraised value. It describes what happens if a home does not sell within a certain period &&#35;40;usually 60 or 90 days&&#35;41;, and the circumstances in which a relocation company will  buy a home.
Establishes the rights and duties of the landlord and tenant in a rental transaction. At a minimum identifies the parties, the property, the term of the rental, and the amount of rent for the term.
Evaluates the rental potential of a property and establishes its value.
Authorizes taxing authority &&#35;40;such as IRS&&#35;41; to provide certified copy of borrowers tax return.
Establishes a requirement for a senior lien holder to inform a junior lien holder in the event of a default on the common property. Required to be recorded.
Establishes the parties and their respective responsibilities to jointly maintain a road.
Confirms that a judgment filed against a property has been released. Provided by a legal authority.
Confirms the security interest has been paid off and the lien on the property is released. Required to be recorded.
Informs the borrower that a loan is considered a high cost loan.  Required by Regulation Z.
Establishes the  lender’s security interest in the real property.
Changes one or more of the terms of a mortgagor's loan in the security instrument.
Adds additional provisions to the security instrument.
Informs the borrower that the right to collect their mortgage loan payments may be transferred, and they have certain rights under federal law. Required by RESPA / Regulation X.
Informs the borrower that the servicing of their loan is being transferred. Required by RESPA / Regulation X.
Describes the funds that are payable at closing. Items that appear on the statement include real estate commissions, loan fees, points, and initial escrow amounts.  Required by RESPA / Regulation X.
Confirms that Social Security benefits are payable and the amount received each month.  Provided by the Social Security Administration.
Confirms whether the property is located in a flood zone and therefore whether it requires flood insurance.  Provided by FEMA.
Describes how the borrower is benefiting from a loan transaction.
Confirms legal ownership of stock in a corporation.
Establishes that a prior lien is made inferior to an otherwise junior lien.  An Agreement between two creditors &&#35;40;lien holders&&#35;41; of a particular borrower.
Establishes that the borrower will set up a subsidy account to supplement the mortgage payment.
Names a successor trustee.
Describes encroachments on mortgaged property.
Confirms that no encroachments have been built since the preceding survey. Provided by the borrower.
Authorizes the tax collector to send the tax bill to the respective mortgagee, servicing or processing organization.
Describes taxes charged by state or local governments.
Evidences a tax lien against a property, person, or entity.
Releases a tax lien against a property, person, or entity.
Provides information used to calculate income or other taxes.
Confirms existence of the insurance policy that covers the property against defects in workmanship. Provided by Insurance company.
Describes the result of a title search of public records.  This is the source document that produces the conditions in a title commitment.  Provided by Title Insurance company.
Establishes a commitment to issue Title insurance subject to payment or other specified conditions. Provided by the Title Insurance company.
Changes one or more of the terms of the Title Insurance Policy.

Establishes that the insurer agrees to pay the insured &&#35;40;a purchaser or mortgagee with an interest in the property&&#35;41; a specific amount for any loss caused by defects of title to the real estate.
Informs the borrower of the annual percentage rate, or APR, of the borrower's loan as well as other facets of the mortgage program.  Required by TILA / Reg Z.
Establishes the terms of a Trust, including the rights and responsibilities of the trustee and the trustor.
Describes property taken as collateral from a borrower.  Required to be filed in public records to record security interest in the property.
Changes the UCC-1 by amending or terminating the security interest.

Describes key information utilized in the comprehensive risk assessment of the mortgage, and the final underwriting decision.  Used for manually-processed applications for single-family conventional first and second mortgages.
Acknowledges the borrower's awareness that the property was not inspected and will not qualify for government assistance in the correction of structural defects.
Confirms a person's veteran status and prior home loan usage.
Confirms the maximum value and loan amount for a VA mortgage.
Informs the borrower of the actions that can be taken by the VA if a borrower defaults on a loan.
Describes the procedure for purchasing a foreclosed VA property.
Informs the borrower of VA funding fee costs.
Determines amount current VA homeowners can reduce their interest rate with no out of pocket expenses and minimal documentation.
Determines whether a veteran qualifies for a VA loan and whether a lenders adheres to VA standards.
Details an update or correction to an appraisal report.

Acknowledges the borrower is aware of the terms of the existing loan and the terms of
the new loan, whether the payment will be increasing or decreasing and how long it takes to recoup all closing costs.
Describes details of a VA closed loan.
Provides VA with information to make determination of a borrower's VA eligibility.
Confirms whether a veteran has the ability to incur debt on a loan.
Confirms borrower credit information.
Confirms dependent care expenses paid by borrower.
Confirms borrowers deposit information.
Confirms borrowers employment information.
Confirms mortgage or rent expenses paid by borrower.
Confirms information about securities owned by borrower.
Authorizes lender to increase borrower's escrow accounts.
Describes the procedure for wiring funds to escrow account. Provided by closing agent.
Authorizes a wire transfer of funds.
Confirms that the recipient is in receipt of funds sent via bank wire process.
Describes the procedure for performing an analysis or making a determination and captures results of the work.
Identifies the state of the documention associated with the loan.
term: Documentation State Type
As requested by the borrower
As collected from the borrower
As required of the borrower
Specifies the type of option used to facilitate the borrowers down payment.
term: Down Payment Option Type

xsd:appinfo.$t: AUS  Enumerated Loan Features  AUS  Down Payment Option Type

xsd:documentation.$t: Specifies the entity providing funds for the down payment.
term: Down Payment Source Type

Specifies the general names &&#35;40;type&&#35;41; of items commonly used for a down payment by the borrower&&#35;40;s&&#35;41; in a mortgage loan transaction. This may be collected on the URLA in Section II &&#35;40;Source of Down Payment&&#35;41;.
term: Down Payment Type

xsd:appinfo.$t: AUS  Enumerated Down Payment  Secondary Delivery AUS Secondary Pricing  Down Payment Type

xsd:documentation.$t: Indicates whether the employment for the borrower is primary or secondary.
term: Employment Classification Type
The type of documentation used as a means of identifying or verifying the borrowers employment used in the transaction
term: Employment Documentation Type
Used to verify employment with a specific employer.

When verbal verification is allowed. This may be a written statement by the lender that information was collected verbally. Might include the name of the person making the contact, the name of the entity contacted, the name and title of the individual at the entity who provided the information, date of the contact and information that was collected.
Used when a third party employment verification vendor provides verification of employment.
Indicates whether the employment for the borrower is current or previous.
term: Employment Status Type
Contains the type of the action performed.
term: Entry Type
Denotes that the document boiler plate has been created. The view is unpopulated and there are no data parts. A SMART Doc® document must contain exactly one audit entry with this action type.
Denotes that draft data has been added to the document or that a previous set of draft data has been modified. A SMART Doc® document may contain zero or more audit entries with this action type
Denotes that the document has been exported to a different electronic format, but the SMART Doc® document is still in effect.
Denotes that the action type is other than the ones listed above. When this option is selected, a description of the action type must be provided in the ActionTypeOtherDescription attribute.

Denotes that the SMART Doc® document has been converted to paper form and that the electronic version no longer has legal force or effect. A SMART Doc® document must not contain more than one audit entries with this action type.

Denotes that the document has been populated with data. The data appears in the original view and may also be present in one or more data parts. A SMART Doc® document must not contain more than one audit entries with this action type.
Denotes that the document has been recorded.
Denotes that a principal party, a witness or a notary has signed the document.  A SMART Doc® document may contain zero or more audit entries with this action type.

Denotes that a system or process has validated the provided data parts against the corresponding readable data in the presentation view. A SMART Doc® document may contain zero or more audit entries with this action type.
Denotes that a system or process has verified that all required signatures for all stakeholder parties, notaries and witnesses have been executed. The document is fully executed.
Denotes that the document no longer has legal force or effect. A SMART Doc® document must not contain more than one audit entries with this action type.
A description of the escrow disbursement type included in a payment for the activity period.
term: Escrow Account Activity Payment Description Type
Specifies the type of Escrow Item.
term: Escrow Item Type
Defines the rounding method applied to the escrow payment.
term: Escrow Monthly Payment Rounding Type
The type of Party responsible for payment of the escrow item.
term: Escrow Paid By Type
Payment period covered by escrow item. If item were paid once a year the payment frequency type would be annual.
term: Escrow Payment Frequency Type
The type of party responsible for the payment of the escrow premium amount.
term: Escrow Premium Paid By Type
The payment method of the premium for the escrow item. Paid Outside of Closing &&#35;40;POC&&#35;41;, Waived or Collect at Closing.
term: Escrow Premium Payment Type
Party responsible for payment of estimated odd days interest.
term: Estimated Prepaid Days Paid By Type
The day basis on which the exception interest adjustment is computed based on the servicing contract.
term: Exception Interest Adjustment Day Method Type
Specifies the type of execution through which the loan was purchased by an investor.
term: Execution Type
Specifies the general names &&#35;40;types&&#35;41; of items commonly listed as expenses of the borrower in a mortgage loan transaction.
term: Expense Type
Periodic amount paid under terms of divorce decree/agreement. Collected on the URLA in Section VI &&#35;40;Liabilities&&#35;41;.
Periodic costs of providing care for having the borrowers dependents. Collected on the URLA in Section VI &&#35;40;Liabilities - Job Related Expenses.&&#35;41;
Periodic amount paid to provide for children after divorce or separation. Collected on the URLA in Section VI &&#35;40;Liabilities - Alimony&&#35;41;.

Ongoing obligations incurred by the borrower which are prerequisite to retaining employment &&#35;40;e.g., professional associations, special uniforms or tools, etc.&&#35;41; Collected on the URLA in Section VI &&#35;40;Liabilities - Job Related Expenses&&#35;41;
Periodic amount paid under terms of separation agreement. Collected on the URLA in Section VI &&#35;40;Liabilities - Alimony.&&#35;41;

Union membership dues borrower incurs as a condition of remaining employment through union &&#35;40;e.g., a closed shop&&#35;41;. Collected on the URLA in Section VI &&#35;40;Liabilities - Job Related Expenses.&&#35;41;
Identifies how the borrower or lender prefers that the judgment process treat alimony in an FHA transaction.
term: FHA Alimony Liability Treatment Type
This means that the alimony is included in the aggregate of obligations.
This means that the income entered is to be reduced by the amount of alimony.
FHA/VA Borrower acknowledgement when Sales Price exceeds the Appraised Value. FHA/VA Borrower Certification, HUD-92900-A &&#35;40;HUD/VA Addendum to URLA&&#35;41;, section 25&&#35;40;3&&#35;41;

A legal or statistical division of a county recognized as part of the Federal Information Processing Standards &&#35;40;FIPS&&#35;41; 55 system. The two major types of county subdivisions are census county divisions and minor civil divisions. This information is used by the US Census Bureau.

A primary governmental and/or administrative subdivision of a county, such as a township, precinct, or magisterial district. MCDs exist in 28 states and the District of Columbia. In 20 states, all or many MCD's are general-purpose governmental units: Connecticut, Illinois, Indiana, Kansas, Maine, Massachusetts, Michigan, Minnesota, Missouri, Nebraska, New Hampshire, New Jersey, New York, North Dakota, Ohio, Pennsylvania, Rhode Island, South Dakota, Vermont, and Wisconsin. Most of these MCD's are legally designated as towns or townships.

A subdivision of a county that is a relatively permanent statistical area established cooperatively by the Census Bureau and state and local government authorities. Used for presenting decennial census statistics in those states that do not have well-defined and stable minor civil divisions that serve as local governments.

The service remits the actual interest net of servicing fees and actual principal collected from the borrower that is due to the investor.

A change in loan status due to a borrower request to exercise the skip payment feature.
A change in loan status due to the foreclosure sale of the borrowers property to pay off a defaulted loan. The property is currently held for sale.
A change in loan status due to the foreclosure sale of the borrowers property to pay off a defaulted loan. The property is awaiting conveyance to purchaser.

A change in loan status due to mortgage insurance cancellation based on original property value.

Borrowed money repaid in several successive payments, usually at regular intervals, for a specific amount & a specified term. Collected on the URLA in Section VI &&#35;40;Liabilities&&#35;41;.
Collected on the URLA in Section VI &&#35;40;Liabilities&&#35;41;.
A closed ended lien secured against a property that may be in a first or subordinate lien position. Collected on the URLA in Section VI &&#35;40;Liabilities&&#35;41;.
Collected on the URLA in Section VI &&#35;40;Liabilities&&#35;41;.
Used in conjunction with a textual description of other types of liabilities.

Open lines of credit, which are subject to variable payments in accordance with the balance. Credit cards are examples of revolving credit. Collected on the URLA in Section VI &&#35;40;Liabilities&&#35;41;.
Taxes levied on borrowers income by local, state, or US Government.
A student loan whose repayment is deferred.
The borrower monthly liability amount used by the lender to qualify the borrower for the loan.
Amount of local, state or federal taxes that are past due and not paid
A notice to an employer or other asset holder that monies, wages, or property of a debtor must be applied to a specific debt or creditor.
Describes the holder of the lien.
term: Lien Holder Type
Specifies the priority of the lien against the subject property.
term: Lien Priority Type

xsd:appinfo.$t: AUS  Enumerated Loan Features, Related Loan, Mortgage Terms  Secondary Delivery Servicing Appraisal AUS Servicing Transfer Secondary Pricing Title  Lien Priority Type

xsd:documentation.$t: A mortgage that gives the mortgagee a security right over all other mortgages of the mortgaged property.
The duration of time used to define the period over which the loan is amortized.
Specifies the unit of time used to define the period between scheduled changes to the UPB.
term: Loan Amortization Period Type
A classification or description of a loan generally based on the changeability of the rate or payment over time.
term: Loan Amortization Type

xsd:appinfo.$t: AUS  Enumerated Mortgage Terms, Related Loan  Secondary Delivery Servicing Appraisal AUS Servicing Transfer Secondary Pricing Title  Loan Amortization Type

xsd:documentation.$t: A mortgage that allows the lender to adjust the interest rate in accordance with a specified index periodically.
A mortgage in which the interest rate and payments remain the same for the life of the loan.
GPM - A type of flexible payment mortgage where the payments increase for a specified period of time and then level off. Usually involves negative amortization.

GEM - A graduated payment mortgage in which increases in a borrowers mortgage payments are used to accelerate reduction of principal on the mortgage. Due to increased payment, the borrower acquires equity more rapidly and retires the debt earlier.
Used to describe the amortization type if it is other than those specified in the enumerated list of Loan Amortization Types.
Periodic payments/rate changes with additional specified principal and interest changes as documented in the Security Instruments.
A type of flexible mortgage where the interest rate may decrease based on payment history.

A mortgage which uses present equity in the property to fund payments from the lender to the borrower-in lieu of the borrower receiving the proceeds of the loan in a lump sum. As a general rule no payments are made from the borrower to the lender and interest is accrued for payment at the end of the mortgage.
Fixed periodic payment/rate changes up to 5 years without subsidy or negative amortization.
Specifies the type of buyup or buydown an eligible seller has elected to exercise for a specific mortgage.
term: Loan Buyup Buydown Type
Defines whether the loan is a closed loan purchase or a table funded loan.
term: Loan Closing Status Type
The loan has already been closed and is now being purchased by an investor.
The loan is being funded with money advanced by the lender at the closing table.
Describes the period of time prior to the note date within which the credit history was obtained.
term: Loan Credit History Age Type
Indicates the party that bears the default loss for the loan.
term: Loan Default Loss Party Type
The frequency that the servicer must report for loans that are in default.
term: Loan Defaulted Reporting Frequency Type
Used to report an event on a delinquent loan.
term: Loan Delinquency Event Type
The Creditors agreed to the restructuring plan.

Legal clearance is under a Chapter 11 bankruptcy. The Loan Delinquency Event Date reported is the date that relief was granted, the date the case was dismissed or some other provision as provided under the bankruptcy plan.

Legal clearance is under a Chapter 7 bankruptcy. The Loan Delinquency Event Date reported is the date that relief was granted, the date the case was dismissed or the later of the Discharge of Debtor or the filing of the Trustee No Asset report/ Abandonment.
The Bankruptcy Court entered confirmation of the Debtors' bankruptcy Chapter 13 plan.
Legal clearance is under a Chapter 13 bankruptcy. The Loan Delinquency Event Date reported is the date that relief was granted or the date the case was dismissed.
The Bankruptcy Court entered confirmation of the Debtors' bankruptcy Chapter 12 plan.
Legal clearance is under a Chapter 12 bankruptcy. The Loan Delinquency Event Date reported is the date that relief was granted or the date the case was dismissed.
The investor has authorized the Servicer to accept a voluntary conveyance of the property instead of initiating foreclosure proceedings. The Servicer has received the executed Deed from the borrower.
The first legal step in processing a foreclosure was taken &&#35;40;i.e. complaint/petition filing, recording notice of default, posting publication of notice of sale, etc&&#35;41;.

Last contact was made by the Servicer or it's agent in the current delinquency period with the Borrower, co-Borrower, a representative of the estate or anyone that is legally responsible for representing any of these individuals. The Loan Delinquency Event Date associated with this status will change every time that there is a contact.

The foreclosure process is restarted after a delay has occurred. Delays such as Bankruptcy, Contested/ Litigated Action, Repayment Plan, Forbearance, Drug Seizure, HUD Assignment/ VA Refunding review, canceled Workout, etc. could suspend the foreclosure process.

A foreclosure sale has been scheduled by the court or sheriff. In a statutory foreclosure state, the Loan Delinquency Event Date reported is the earliest date after the publication has expired on which the sale could occur. If the foreclosure sale is rescheduled, the Loan Delinquency Event Date reported is the updated foreclosure sale date.
The borrower has restored the delinquent mortgage to current status by paying the total amount delinquent, including advances, accrued interest, legal costs and other expenses.

Last contact was made by the Servicer or it's agent in the current delinquency period with the Borrower, co-Borrower, a representative of the estate or anyone that is legally responsible for representing any of these individuals. The Loan Delinquency Event Date associated with this status will change every time that there is a contact.

The borrower pays an amount less than the total amount delinquent, including advances, accrued interest, legal costs and other expenses and agrees to a repayment plan to bring the account current within a defined period of time.
This event occurs when the Borrower does not keep their commitment to make payment promised by a specified date.
This event occurs when the Borrower kept their commitment and made a payment that they promised to make by a specified date.
This event occurs when the Borrower verbally promises to make a payment by a specified date.
Notification from property inspections, the Borrower or some other source that the property securing the Mortgage was listed for sale.
Real estate owned loan after foreclosure sale has been completed. Title has reverted to the beneficiary.
The first payment negotiated under a Repayment Plan is received by the Servicer.
The property sold to a 3rd Party Purchaser at the foreclosure sale and did not revert to the Servicer/ Investor.
The reason why the Borrower has become delinquent on the loan.
term: Loan Delinquency Reason Type
The borrower has abandoned the property for reasons that are not known &&#35;40;the Servicer has been unable to locate the borrower&&#35;41;.
The failure of a self-employed borrower's business, or the inability of the business to generate sufficient profit, has reduced the borrower's ability to meet his or her financial obligations.
The borrower has experienced a sudden, unexpected property as a result of an accident, fire, storm, theft, earthquake, etc.
The borrower's income has been reduced, because of a garnishment of wages, a change to a lower paying job, reduced commissions or overtime pay, loss of a part-time job, etc.

The principal borrower has incurred extraordinary expenses because of the death of a family member or because of taking on sole responsibility for repayment of the mortgage as a result of the co-borrower's death.
The principal borrower has died.

The principal borrower has been transferred or relocated to a distant job location. The additional expenses for moving and housing in the new location have affected his or her ability to pay those expensed and the mortgage debt.
The borrower has incurred excessive energy related costs, or costs associated with the removal of environmental hazards, in, on, or near the property.
The borrower has incurred excessive debts &&#35;40;either in a single instance or built up over time&&#35;41; that prevent him or her from making payments on both those debts and the mortgage debt.
The delinquency is attributable to a legal dispute arising from a fraudulent or illegal action that occurred in connection with the origination of the mortgage &&#35;40;or later&&#35;41;.

The principal borrower has incurred extraordinary expenses because of the illness of a family member or because of taking on sole responsibility for repayment of the mortgage as a result of the co-borrower's illness.
A prolonged illness keeps the principal borrower from working and generating income.

The borrower needs rental income to make the mortgage payments and is having difficulty in finding a tenant for a one-family investment property or for one or more of the units in a one- to four-family property.
The borrower is having difficulty selling the property.
The principal borrower has been imprisoned &&#35;40;regardless of whether he or she is still incarcerated&&#35;41;.

Problems associated with separation or divorce - such as a dispute over ownership of the property, a decision not to make payments until the divorce settlement is final, a reduction in the income available to repay the mortgage debt, etc. - are affecting the borrower's ability to make mortgage payments.
The principal borrower has been called to active duty, but his or her military pay is not sufficient to continue to pay the existing mortgage debt.
The delinquency is attributable to reasons that are not otherwise included in the enumerated list.

An increase in the scheduled payment of a graduated payment or adjustable-rate mortgage; increased monthly escrow accruals needed to pay higher taxes, insurance premiums, or special assessments; or the need to make up an escrow shortage over the next year, is affecting the borrower's ability to make the new payment.

The borrower refuses to make payment&&#35;40;s&&#35;41; because of a disagreement with the Servicer about the amount of the mortgage payment, the acceptance of a partial payment, or the application of previous payments, until the dispute is resolved.

The condition of the property &&#35;40;substandard construction, expensive and extensive repairs needed, subsidence or sinkholes on property, impaired rights on ingress and egress, etc.&&#35;41; or the dissatisfaction with the property or the neighborhood is affecting the borrower's willingness to pay the mortgage.

There is a dispute by the Borrower in regards to how their loan has been serviced, normally centered around escrow advances, application of payments or interest rate changes. This would be used if the Servicer is having operational issues that are preventing them from effectively servicing the loan &&#35;40;loan set up problems, lock box delays, transfer of servicing, etc.&&#35;41;
The borrower has agreed to sell the property and has decided not to make any additional payments.
The reason for the delinquency cannot be determined because the borrower cannot be located or has not responded to inquiries.
The principal borrower's income has been reduced because of a loss of job.
Loan Delinquency Status Type is used to report the status of a delinquent loan &&#35;40;i.e., is the loan in delinquency, foreclosure, bankruptcy, or some other status&&#35;41;.
term: Loan Delinquency Status Type

xsd:appinfo.$t: Enumerated Delinquency Notification Status  Servicing Investor Reporting SEC  Loan Delinquency Status Type

xsd:documentation.$t: An FHA-insured mortgage that qualifies for HUD special assignment procedures is in the process of being assigned to HUD.
The Servicer is working with the borrower to sell the property by permitting the purchaser to pay the delinquent installments and assume the outstanding debt.
The borrower has filed for bankruptcy under Chapter 11 of the Federal Bankruptcy Act.
The borrower has filed for bankruptcy under Chapter 7 of the Federal Bankruptcy Act.
The borrower has filed for bankruptcy under Chapter 13 of the Federal Bankruptcy Act.
The borrower has filed for bankruptcy under Chapter 12 of the Federal Bankruptcy Act. A Chapter 12 bankruptcy is a bankruptcy action that involves the reorganization of a family farming business.

The investor has agreed not to pursue collection efforts or legal actions against the borrower because of a reduced value for the property, a low outstanding mortgage balance, or the presence of environmental hazards on the property.

Borrower has contested the servicer's legal action or there is litigation pending or filed that adversely affects the property. For example, a borrower or other defendant interposes an answer to an action, or files a countersuit.
The Department of Justice or a state/local agency has decided to seize &&#35;40;or has seized&&#35;41; a property under the forfeiture provision of the Controlled Substances Act.

The Servicer has authorized a temporary suspension of payments or a repayment plan that calls for periodic payments of less than the normal monthly payment, or periodic payments at different intervals, to give the borrower additional time to bring the mortgage current.
The Servicer has referred the case to an attorney to take legal action to acquire the property through a foreclosure sale.
An action by a local agency to seize or initiate forfeiture proceedings against a property. Servicer is considering next course of action.
The Servicer has granted a delinquent service member forbearance or a stay in foreclosure proceedings under the provisions of the Soldiers' and Sailors' Civil Relief Act.
The Servicer is working with the borrower to renegotiate the terms of the mortgage.
The Servicer plans to pursue a preforeclosure sale with a payoff of less than the full amount of indebtedness.
The Servicer cannot pursue &&#35;40;or complete&&#35;41; foreclosure action because proceedings required to verify a deceased mortgagor's will are in process.
The Servicer is pursuing a new loan in which the existing first mortgage is paid off with the proceeds of the new mortgage.
A written or verbal agreement between the Servicer and the borrower that gives the borrower a defined period of time to reinstate the mortgage by making payments in excess of the monthly payment.
The Servicer is evaluating the pros and cons of pursuing foreclosure or recommending that the debt be charged off on a second mortgage.

The investor has agreed to make a cash contribution to reduce the outstanding indebtedness of a VA-guaranteed mortgage, for which the Department of Veterans Affairs failed to establish an "upset price" bid for the foreclosure sale, in order to get the VA to reconsider its decision. Servicer has completed processing the Buydown.

The Department of Veterans Affairs refused to establish an "upset price" to be bid at the foreclosure sale of a VA-guaranteed mortgage that the Servicer had referred for foreclosure. Servicer is pursuing a buydown, charge-off or other alternative.

The Department of Veterans Affairs has requested information about a VA-guaranteed mortgage the Servicer had referred for foreclosure in order to decide whether to accept an assignment and refund the mortgage.
Specifies the method used to select the Loan Level Credit Score across all borrowers.
Specifies the method used to select the Loan Credit Score across all borrowers.
term: Loan Level Credit Score Selection Method Type
The mean value of the average of each borrower.
Mean value of the middle or lower score per set of borrower scores.
Lowest value of the middle or lower score per set of borrower scores.
Describes how to calculate the margin on the loan.
term: Loan Margin Calculation Method Type
The unit of time used for defining the period over which the loan matures.
term: Loan Maturity Period Type
Specifies an action that has already taken place that has modified the loan terms &&#35;40;i.e., interest rate, principal balance, and or payment&&#35;41;.
Specifies an action that has already taken place which has modified the loan terms.
term: Loan Modification Event Type
Fees or interest have been capitalized into the UPB.
Identifies type of monetary event that affects balances associated with a loan.
term: Monetary Event Type

xsd:documentation.$t: A scheduled payment on a mortgage that is larger than other periodic payments but where the loan obligation is not fully satisfied.
A payment which reduces the outstanding amount of a reverse mortgage set aside account for first year property charges.
A payment of additional principal not scheduled as part of the borrower's line of credit.
A payment which reduces the outstanding amount of a reverse mortgage set aside account for repairs.
A payment which reduces the outstanding amount of a reverse mortgage set aside account for tax and insurance payments.
A payment of principal to reduce the accumulated loan balance when there is no scheduled installment due on the loan.
A regular draw from the borrower's line of credit.
Last draw during the construction phase of a construction to permanent loan.
Last draw during the construction phase of a construction to permanent loan converting to a permanent loan earlier than the original scheduled conversion date.
Last draw during the construction phase of a construction to permanent loan with a principal paydown to the permanent loan.

Last draw during the construction phase of a construction to permanent loan converting to a permanent loan earlier than the original scheduled conversion date with a principal paydown to the permanent loan.
The final advancement of funds from that portion of a borrower's reverse mortgage set aside account for first year property charges.
Funds advanced from the portion of a borrower's reverse mortgage set aside account for first year property charges.
Funds advanced from the borrower's line of credit associated with a reverse mortgage for appraisal fees.
Funds advanced from the borrower's line of credit associated with a reverse mortgage to prevent a lien against the property.
Principal and or Interest Payment where the loan is not paid off.
A payment of additional principal not scheduled as part of a normal monthly installment.
The final advancement of funds from that portion of a borrower's reverse mortgage set aside account for repairs.
Funds advanced from the portion of a borrower's reverse mortgage set aside account for repairs.
Funds advanced from the portion of a borrower's reverse mortgage set aside account for tax and insurance payments.
Denotes the method of resolving a loan that has reached the negative amortization limit percent.
term: Loan Negative Amortization Resolution Type
Recalculate the principal and interest payment to fully amortize the loan over the remaining term.
Borrower pays the amount by which the loan has negatively amortized.
Modify the term of the mortgage and recalculate the fully amortizing mortgage over the newly extended remaining term.
Extend the term as needed to fully amortize the loan up to the maximum allowed stated term on the note.
Specifies the type of party that originated the loan.
term: Loan Originator Type

Property Value not established using appraisal standard of the investor.
Loan is a Balloon or a balloon with reset option.
Cash back to borrower exceeded allowable level to be considered no-cash back.
Loan has high risk of default primarily due to risky combination of LTV and borrower creditworthiness.
Original LTV on loan up to 97percent.
Property does not have sufficient flood insurance coverage.
A fee or adjustment based on the difference between the interest rate of the loan and the required yield of the lender or investor.
Property use is non-owner-occupied
Transaction includes certain secondary financing structures.
Charge based on the duration of a price lock.
A fee or adjustment based on the difference between the margin rate of the loan and the standard margin for the loan product.
Modifiable Loan in lieu of a refinance.
Collateral has more than one dwelling unit.
Income and/or asset documentation varied from investor standard.
Loan originated more than 12 months prior to investor funding.
Loan has Lien Priority Type of Second.
The premium paid for releasing loan servicing.
Origination process streamlined from Investor standard.
Loan originated as Texas equity refinance.
Original LTV on loan greater than 97 percent.
Describes the format of the price as being relative to par &&#35;40;0-Base&&#35;41; or absolute &&#35;40;100-base&&#35;41;.
term: Loan Price Percent Format Type

The supply chain of loans, both before and after a loan closing involves funds to purchase the asset and expected or real income from the sale of the asset.  In the supply chain one organizations sale price is another organization's purchace price.
term: Loan Price Quote Type
At any point in the supply chain of loans, information about the costs of buying the loan collateral asset or the servicing rights to the loan is placed in the container with this attribute.

At any point in the supply chain of loans, information about the potential of actual income from the sale of the loan collateral asset or the servicing rights to the loan is placed in the container with this attribute.
The status of the particular loan product.

Specifies the purpose for which the loan proceeds will be used.

The repayment of a debt from proceeds of a new loan using the same property as security  or a mortgage secured by a property previously owned free and clear by the Borrower.
Loan Purpose has not been reported or is not known.
Specifies whether the loan payment schedule has been calculated to fully repay the loan over the mortgage term.

Used as a attribute on LOAN to distinguish subject loans from related loans.
term: Loan Role Type
Identifies the state in time for the information associated with this occurrence of LOAN.
term: Loan State Type
A snapshot of the loan data at the completion of the closing process.  This is sometimes referred to as "original".

For loans with a conversion option, a snapshot of the loan data at the time the conversion features become effective &&#35;40;e.g., biweekly to monthly payments; adjustable to fixed rate amortization&&#35;41;.
For loans which undergo term modifications not originally specified in the note, a snapshot of the loan data at the time the new note terms become effective.
For balloon mortgages with a reset feature, a snapshot of the loan data on the balloon maturity date at the time the borrower exercises the reset option to modify and extend the balloon note.
A snapshot of the loan data as of the "Loan State Date".
Specifies the type of entity that submitted the loan for underwriting.
Specifies the type of entity who submitted the loan for underwriting.
term: Loan Underwriting Submitter Type
A party who, for a commission, matches borrowers and lenders. A mortgage broker takes applications and sometimes processes loans, but generally does not use its own funds for closing.
A specialized type of mortgage banker whose function is limited to the origination of mortgage loans which are sold to other mortgage bankers or investment bankers under a specific commitment.
The party that invests in or originates mortgage loans. The lender is generally whosever name the loan is closed in.
The party selling the loan in the subject transaction.
Specifies the general types of loss payees associated with the mortgage loan.

The status of the loans registration with MERS. A loan is registered one time with MERS with its Mortgage Identification Number &&#35;40;MIN&&#35;41;. Various life of loan activities may alter the registration status such as a deactivation transaction.

The status of the loans registration with MERS. A loan is registered one time with MERS with its Mortgage Identification Number &&#35;40;MIN&&#35;41;. Various activities may alter the registration status such as the servicing transfer to a lender not active with MERS or a loans foreclosure.

The recording endorsement from any additional jurisdictions where the document is recorded.  Used only if a single document must be recorded in multiple jurisdictions and if the document submitted for recording already contains a completed PrimaryRecordingJurisdiction element.

An additional recording endorsement from the PrimaryRecordingJurisdicition.  Used when an error in a document is discovered after it has been recorded.  The document is corrected in accordance with jurisdictional requirements and resubmitted to the recording jurisdiction an additional time.

The recording endorsement information from a document that is already in the public record and is referenced in the body of a new document.  E.g.: a ‘Satisfaction of Mortgage’ would reference the recording endorsement information from the original mortgage in the body of the Satisfaction.

The recording endorsement from the jurisdiction where the document is being recorded.  If the document needs to be recorded in more than one jurisdiction, this would be the used by the first jurisdiction to record the document.

Specifies whether the signature field is for a full signature or for an initials mark.
term: Signature Field Mark Type
Denotes that the signature field is a for a full signature
Denotes that the signature field is for an initials mark.
Contains the signature type proposed by the document creator. The actual type of the signature applied to the signature field may be different &&#35;40;please see audit trail&&#35;41;
The ActualSignatureType contains the actual type of the signature applied to the signature field.
term: Signature Type
term: Actual Signature Type
Denotes a text signature. The signer types his/her name &&#35;40;signature&&#35;41; in the signature field or clicks a button onscreen indicating acceptance or agreement.
Denotes an image signature. A graphic image of the signers signature  is captured and placed in signature field.

Denotes a digital signature. The signer uses a digital certificate to apply a PKI-based signature to the document. The certificate maybe a personal certificate of the signer, a system certificate, or a dynamically generated certificate created for that transaction. After signing a signature appearance is generated and place on the signature field in the view.
Denotes that the signature type is other than the ones listed above. When this option is selected, a description of the signature type must be provided in the SignatureTypeOtherDescription attribute.
